<div>
It is estimated that about 6% to 7% of the U.S. population may be gluten-sensitive, meaning some 20 million people in the United States alone could have gluten sensitivity.

Living with a gluten sensitivity or gluten intolerance, you may start to feel like the world just isn't made for people like you. Everywhere you look, you see foods that you can't eat. It is tough to adhere to a gluten-free diet, costing you money, creating stress for you, and forcing you to avoid some restaurants altogether.

We share your concerns and empathize with your pain. Recognizing just what a hassle it can be to live in such a gluten-saturated world, we made it our mission to devise a solution.
<div>

HAPPYGUT is the world's first probiotic engineered to aid in the digestion of gluten. In addition to helping break down gluten inside your body, HAPPYGUT will also optimize the gut balance that empowers you to avoid constipation, bloating, and indigestion, keeping your good bacteria-bad bacteria ratio perfectly in check (at 85-15).
<div>
<div>
We found a gluten breaker(probiotics) from Korean fermented foods – Kimchi!
<div>

Kimchi is loaded with vitamins A, B, and C, but its biggest benefit is “healthy bacteria” called lactobacilli, found in fermented foods. This good bacteria helps with digestion and aids to stop and even prevent yeast infections.

Simply put, gluten is a combination of 2 proteins, found primarily in wheat and related grains such as barley and rye. These two proteins called gliadin and glutenin combine, creating gluten which helps to nourish the plant's embryos, and is a major component in giving the foods you eat that chewy goodness. If you experience recurring bloating, diarrhea, constipation, brain fog, and fatigue, you may have gluten/wheat sensitivity.
<ul>
• From pizza to pasta to bread, some of our most delicious foods contain gluten. This is why gluten-sensitive people have so much trouble sticking to their diets.
• On average, gluten-free food is approximately 245% more expensive as compared to their gluten-based products
• As you try to eat out, you are likely to come into contact with cross-contamination.
If you’re experiencing bloating, constipation, diarrhea after most meals, you may be experiencing the chronic gut disorder. Chronic gut disorders can ruin your life.
The enzymes in happy gut helps break down such and such, providing relief after meals. ​​

We made HAPPYGUT from probiotics extracted from traditional Korean fermented ingredients. When tested on Udon noodles, HAPPYGUT was proven to be effective, as it broke down up to 70% of the gluten content. Also, in order for probiotics to be active in the body, it must be resistant to gastric acid in the stomach and bile acid in the small intestine, which is highly acidic substances. The probiotics in HAPPYGUT have been proven to have a very high acid resistance rate. $84 worth of probiotics contained in HAPPYGUT survived after 2 hours at a pH level of 3.0, demonstrating its excellent ability to resist acids.

column3:
showinfo=0"" width=""695"">
 

 

Probiotics are live-bacteria and therefore its viability within the expiration date is very important. Although probiotics are very beneficial bacteria, there are many limitations in storage and use. Unlike other industrial brands that use fermented products, with our patented dual-coating technology using polysaccharide and β-glucan derived from mycelia of snow fungus, the bacteria Lactobacillus contained in HAPPYGUT is what makes it remarkably different from other products. It has a higher survival rate to last in the stomach and the intestines.

It allows HAPPYGUT to be your daily probiotic on the go! 

Synbiotic is a mix of good bacteria (probiotics) and fiber (prebiotics). Put simply, fiber is food for the good bacteria so that they can grow strong and multiply once they have reached the intestine.


""Pizza and bread are two of my favorite foods, and there is a ton of flour in them both. Whenever I eat them, I end up bloated and breaking out in pimples. I have wondered for a long time what the solution is. Thankfully, I have found what I need. It's KIMCHI, a superfood contained in Korean traditional cuisine. After scientific research, we have extracted a microbe from KIMCHI that breaks down gluten, and from this microbe, we have derived HAPPYGUT. I hope that HAPPYGUT is as exciting for you as it is for me. You can enjoy your gluten in peace from now on!""
column5:

For more information on how to get Blync, visit our website www.blync.bike

HOW I CAME UP WITH THE IDEA

The idea for Blync came to me when my wife bought her bike but could not ride it because of her busy work schedule and our two young kids. As I was looking for a solution, I got to experience VR for the first time. 

I then asked, “What if I can make my wife feel like she is riding outside while she is at home using a VR system?” This is how I began developing Blync.

With my background in hardware and software systems design, together with a team of engineers and designers, we are committed to make Blync a reality with the highest quality possible. Thank you for your support!

 

Introducing Blync

VR has opened up various ways for us to experience reality. Imagine biking through different virtual environments from the comfort of your living room. With a quick setup, Blync lets you venture across various terrains as if you were outdoors!

 

 

CYCLE THROUGH CHALLENGING TERRAIN SAFELY. While biking can be a refreshing fitness activity, it also comes with safety risks. Blync lets you get the thrill of biking on dangerous terrains from the safety of your home.

 

MAINTAIN HEALTHY FITNESS LEVELS. Finally, you don't have to cancel cycling rides during winter. Blync helps you have consistent fitness activity for improved physical well-being. Ride your bike at any time of the day or any season of the year.

 

REALISTIC CYCLING EXPERIENCE. Blync is made up of a path sensor and speed sensor. While other virtual bikes mainly control where you go on the virtual world while you pedal, Blync's path sensor allows you to turn and control where you want to go. Feel free to do stunts or explore the world in VR! Blync also records your fitness activities like calories burnt, average riding power and average speed.

 

COMFORTABLE RIDING EXPERIENCE. One of the main issues people experience (especially for newcomers to VR) is feeling dizzy during motion. Blync lets you toggle between first- and third-person mode to help minimize or eliminate dizziness. We also fine-tuned the system to be as real as riding a physical bike outdoors. Lastly, users can also ride with their computer screen or laptop.

 

 

What's In The Box

 

Blync package contains the Path Sensor, the Speed sensor and access to the App with all the environments that you can bike in. The Path Sensor is designed to support any wheel size of a bike. You just need to place your bike's front wheel on the Path Sensor, strap the speed sensor at your back wheel's hub and you are done with the setup.

Your back wheel needs to be secured on a bike trainer. Bike trainers are commercial fitness equipment that securely mounts your bike for indoor biking. For more information on bike trainers, visit our website www.blync.bike

Blync works with a VR device as well as computers. If you don't have a VR device, you can enjoy your virtual biking using a computer screen. We are working to support most popular VR devices and will continually add support for more. For more info on VR devices visit our website www.blync.bike

 

 

Blync Hardware Progression
column3:
showinfo=0"">

 

 

We are launching Blync on Kickstarter to build a strong community of cycling enthusiasts that want to explore beautiful terrains. 

Seeing that there are enough people that want our product gives us a huge boost in motivation to bring Blync to life.

 

Perk Details

column2:
>Update: We are excited to have met our Indiegogo goal.  We have opened up another round of pre-orders through the website that aim to ship in May 2021. Visit bumblebls.com/shop

 

Bumble BLS is an innovative new bilateral stimulation system designed for therapists to use with their clients during sessions, as well as for people of all ages to use for stress relief and emotional regulation at home.  We are offering a line of BLS Buzzies and if we surpass our ""stretch goals"" we will add options for a EMDR light bar and Buzzies that can be remotely operated.
column3:
>Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform designed to give new businesses a jump-start and help assure that there is enough interest in their product to officially launch.  It is an ""all or nothing"" system, where if the minimum goal is not met all funds collected are refunded.  Please order now and promote to your friends to get this product to production.

 

Our Story

The story of Bumble BLS begins with Registered Play Therapist Lauren Stockly. Lauren saw firsthand the powerful positive benefits her clients received from bilateral stimulation, a technique that naturally calms the nervous system by introducing vibrations to the right and left sides of the body in an alternating rhythm.  The app can control the speed, length of the pause between pulses, the duration of the pulse and the intensity. But she wanted a product that her young clients could easily use during play therapy without being inhibited by wires—something durable enough for kids, convenient enough for parents and compact enough for anyone wanting to try bilateral stimulation at home, work or school. Lauren set out to create this product, combining her insights as a therapist with leading-edge technology and decades of neuroscience research. Whether you are an EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing) therapist, a play therapist, the parent of a child who struggles emotionally or someone looking to manage stress, Bumble BLS products are here to help.

 

Buzzies for EMDR: Designed with EMDR therapists in mind, Bumble BLS products offer durable construction, wireless performance and both manual and Bluetooth control. EMDR clients can wear Buzzies on the included wristbands, or remove them for handheld bilateral stimulation. Buzzies are easy to sanitize,  and can be operated at a distance during in-person sessions.  Clients can also use them at home—along with Bumble BLS in-app visuals—during teletherapy. If this project exceeds its goal times eight, it will unlock a “stretch goal” for an upgraded model that therapists can control remotely (if this perk is ""unlocked"" you will be given the option to pay extra to upgrade to the remote-operated version).

 

Buzzies for Therapy &
column4:
Play Therapy: In non-EMDR sessions, Buzzies can  help clients regulate their emotions as they explore their windows of tolerance. Clients can also use Buzzies at home for resourcing or to help regulate the nervous system as a coping tool. With their wireless design, sand- and water-proof construction, and easy-to-clean material, Bumble BLS Buzzies are especially great for play therapists. Children can keep them in their pockets during play therapy sessions to help them stay grounded as they process, or use them with our fun ladybug-shaped plush cases.

 

Buzzies at Home: Whether you are managing your own stress, or using them with your children during tantrums, bilateral stimulation with Buzzies  promote emotional regulation. Buzzies offer unmatched convenience and versatility. Wear them on the included wristbands, or detach and stash them in your pockets or socks. Plus, Buzzies can mount to any universal 18mm watch band. However you use them, Buzzies will be you and your family’s new go-to solution for natural calming.

Bilateral stimulation is a powerful and 100 percent natural way to calm the nervous system and slow the release of the stress hormone cortisol. Tactile bilateral stimulation is done by introducing gentle vibrations to the left and right sides of the body in an alternating rhythm, which soothes the body’s fight or flight response, lessening the symptoms of anxiety and opening the brain to enhanced focus and therapeutic progress. This concept forms the basis of Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR), the world’s leading trauma therapy, which utilizes bilateral stimulation to help clients reprocess traumatic memories.

You don’t need to be in a therapy session to benefit from bilateral stimulation. Whether you are managing your own stress, or using them with your children during tantrums or other emotional struggles, bilateral stimulation with Buzzies is an effective way to promote a natural sense of calm. Buzzies can be used preventatively, in response to anxiety, or to help kids manage their feelings. The bilateral stimulation offered by Buzzies has also been shown to support emotional regulation and mitigate sensory sensitivity in people with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Whether you plan to use bilateral stimulation with your children or on your own, Buzzies offer unmatched convenience and versatility. Wear them on the included wristbands, or detach and stash them in your pockets or socks. Plus, Buzzies can mount to any universal 18mm watch band. However you use them, Buzzies will be you and your family

 

Product Features 

Buzzies

Each set of Bumble BLS Buzzies includes a pair of compact vibrating units the size of a wristwatch. Buzzies take bilateral stimulation to the next level, offering wireless operation, a completely water- and sand-proof design, and precise Bluetooth control via our Bumble BLS app for iOS and Android. Bumble BLS Buzzies deliver gentle vibrations that alternate from left to right, mediating the body’s stress response while promoting calm and focus. Control the intensity and speed of Buzzies with convenient buttons or download our user-friendly smartphone app for even greater customization. Bumble BLS Buzzies include the following features:
column5:
> 

App

Use our app to control your Bumble BLS devices with a simple tap. The app allows you to adjust the speed, duration and intensity of Buzzie vibrations. As an added bonus, it includes original content for aural and visual bilateral stimulation during EMDR sessions. The Bumble BLS app will be available for iOS and Android in both English and Mandarin, and includes the following features:

column1: • Bluetooth controls for Buzzies
• Ultra-customizable settings
• Original bilateral stimulation visuals for EMDR therapy
• Bilateral stimulation audio tones for EMDR therapy
• Soothing bilateral stimulation music
• All features included for free

column2:
>

 

Light Bar: Pre-Orders Open in July 2021

The Bumble BLS Light Bar is a portable, affordable and top-quality solution for EMDR therapists. There are no wires to get in the way, plus it can fold easily for compact storage when not in use. Our Light Bar has a built-in stand that allows it to be placed on a table or self, along with an attachment for a universal tripod. It can be used alone or synced with Bumble BLS Buzzies. The Bumble BLS Light Bar includes the following features:

About Us

Lauren Stockly, LCSW, RPT-S, ECMHS, PPSC is the founder of Bumble BLS. She is a child and adolescent mental health therapist who specializes in using play therapy to treat trauma and support emotional growth for children and families. In addition to her practice, Lauren serves on the board of the California Association for Play Therapy, and shares interventions and resources through her popular blog, CreativePlayTherapist.com. She is also the author of “Be Mindful of Monsters,” a therapeutic children’s book that teaches how the practice of mindfulness can help us accept even our most difficult emotions.

The inspiration for Bumble BLS came from Lauren’s day to day work as a play therapist. She noticed the strong positive impacts of EMDR therapy and bilateral stimulation on her clients, but couldn’t find a product that was specifically geared toward the needs of children during play therapy sessions. She wanted something durable that was sand- and water-proof, as well as wireless, so that her clients could play freely while processing with bilateral stimulation. Lauren also wanted a versatile product that could deliver bilateral for stress relief at home, work or school. After a year and a half of conceptualizing, designing and planning, Lauren’s vision is nearly a reality.
column3:
>

","Update: We are excited to have met our Indiegogo goal.  We have opened up another round of pre-orders through the website that aim to ship in May 2021. Visit bumblebls.com/shop Bumble BLS is an innovative new bilateral stimulation system designed for therapists to use with their clients during sessions, as well as for people of all ages to use for stress relief and emotional regulation at home.  We are offering a line of BLS Buzzies and if we surpass our ""stretch goals"" we will add options for a EMDR light bar and Buzzies that can be remotely operated.Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform designed to give new businesses a jump-start and help assure that there is enough interest in their product to officially launch.  It is an ""all or nothing"" system, where if the minimum goal is not met all funds collected are refunded.  Please order now and promote to your friends to get this product to production. Our StoryThe story of Bumble BLS begins with Registered Play Therapist Lauren Stockly. Lauren saw firsthand the powerful positive benefits her clients received from bilateral stimulation, a technique that naturally calms the nervous system by introducing vibrations to the right and left sides of the body in an alternating rhythm.  The app can control the speed, length of the pause between pulses, the duration of the pulse and the intensity. But she wanted a product that her young clients could easily use during play therapy without being inhibited by wires—something durable enough for kids, convenient enough for parents and compact enough for anyone wanting to try bilateral stimulation at home, work or school. Lauren set out to create this product, combining her insights as a therapist with leading-edge technology and decades of neuroscience research. Whether you are an EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing) therapist, a play therapist, the parent of a child who struggles emotionally or someone looking to manage stress, Bumble BLS products are here to help. Buzzies for EMDR: Designed with EMDR therapists in mind, Bumble BLS products offer durable construction, wireless performance and both manual and Bluetooth control. EMDR clients can wear Buzzies on the included wristbands, or remove them for handheld bilateral stimulation. Buzzies are easy to sanitize,  and can be operated at a distance during in-person sessions.  Clients can also use them at home—along with Bumble BLS in-app visuals—during teletherapy. If this project exceeds its goal times eight, it will unlock a “stretch goal” for an upgraded model that therapists can control remotely (if this perk is ""unlocked"" you will be given the option to pay extra to upgrade to the remote-operated version). Buzzies for Therapy & Play Therapy: In non-EMDR sessions, Buzzies can  help clients regulate their emotions as they explore their windows of tolerance. Clients can also use Buzzies at home for resourcing or to help regulate the nervous system as a coping tool. With their wireless design, sand- and water-proof construction, and easy-to-clean material, Bumble BLS Buzzies are especially great for play therapists. Children can keep them in their pockets during play therapy sessions to help them stay grounded as they process, or use them with our fun ladybug-shaped plush cases. Buzzies at Home: Whether you are managing your own stress, or using them with your children during tantrums, bilateral stimulation with Buzzies  promote emotional regulation. Buzzies offer unmatched convenience and versatility. Wear them on the included wristbands, or detach and stash them in your pockets or socks. Plus, Buzzies can mount to any universal 18mm watch band. However you use them, Buzzies will be you and your family’s new go-to solution for natural calming.Bilateral stimulation is a powerful and 100 percent natural way to calm the nervous system and slow the release of the stress hormone cortisol. Tactile bilateral stimulation is done by introducing gentle vibrations to the left and right sides of the body in an alternating rhythm, which soothes the body’s fight or flight response, lessening the symptoms of anxiety and opening the brain to enhanced focus and therapeutic progress. This concept forms the basis of Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing (EMDR), the world’s leading trauma therapy, which utilizes bilateral stimulation to help clients reprocess traumatic memories.You don’t need to be in a therapy session to benefit from bilateral stimulation. Whether you are managing your own stress, or using them with your children during tantrums or other emotional struggles, bilateral stimulation with Buzzies is an effective way to promote a natural sense of calm. Buzzies can be used preventatively, in response to anxiety, or to help kids manage their feelings. The bilateral stimulation offered by Buzzies has also been shown to support emotional regulation and mitigate sensory sensitivity in people with autism spectrum disorder (ASD). Whether you plan to use bilateral stimulation with your children or on your own, Buzzies offer unmatched convenience and versatility. Wear them on the included wristbands, or detach and stash them in your pockets or socks. Plus, Buzzies can mount to any universal 18mm watch band. However you use them, Buzzies will be you and your family Product Features BuzziesEach set of Bumble BLS Buzzies includes a pair of compact vibrating units the size of a wristwatch. Buzzies take bilateral stimulation to the next level, offering wireless operation, a completely water- and sand-proof design, and precise Bluetooth control via our Bumble BLS app for iOS and Android. Bumble BLS Buzzies deliver gentle vibrations that alternate from left to right, mediating the body’s stress response while promoting calm and focus. Control the intensity and speed of Buzzies with convenient buttons or download our user-friendly smartphone app for even greater customization. Bumble BLS Buzzies include the following features: AppUse our app to control your Bumble BLS devices with a simple tap. The app allows you to adjust the speed, duration and intensity of Buzzie vibrations. As an added bonus, it includes original content for aural and visual bilateral stimulation during EMDR sessions. The Bumble BLS app will be available for iOS and Android in both English and Mandarin, and includes the following features:

column1: Bluetooth controls for Buzzies
Ultra-customizable settings
Original bilateral stimulation visuals for EMDR therapy
Bilateral stimulation audio tones for EMDR therapy
Soothing bilateral stimulation music
All features included for free

Light Bar: Pre-Orders Open in July 2021The Bumble BLS Light Bar is a portable, affordable and top-quality solution for EMDR therapists. There are no wires to get in the way, plus it can fold easily for compact storage when not in use. Our Light Bar has a built-in stand that allows it to be placed on a table or self, along with an attachment for a universal tripod. It can be used alone or synced with Bumble BLS Buzzies. The Bumble BLS Light Bar includes the following features:About UsLauren Stockly, LCSW, RPT-S, ECMHS, PPSC is the founder of Bumble BLS. She is a child and adolescent mental health therapist who specializes in using play therapy to treat trauma and support emotional growth for children and families. In addition to her practice, Lauren serves on the board of the California Association for Play Therapy, and shares interventions and resources through her popular blog, CreativePlayTherapist.com. She is also the author of “Be Mindful of Monsters,” a therapeutic children’s book that teaches how the practice of mindfulness can help us accept even our most difficult emotions.The inspiration for Bumble BLS came from Lauren’s day to day work as a play therapist. She noticed the strong positive impacts of EMDR therapy and bilateral stimulation on her clients, but couldn’t find a product that was specifically geared toward the needs of children during play therapy sessions. She wanted something durable that was sand- and water-proof, as well as wireless, so that her clients could play freely while processing with bilateral stimulation. Lauren also wanted a versatile product that could deliver bilateral for stress relief at home, work or school. After a year and a half of conceptualizing, designing and planning, Lauren’s vision is nearly a reality.",5.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Los Angeles, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/calming-bilateral-stimulation-wearables/pica

All the money raised here will be to cover legal fees involved with defending the rights to make basic computer-controlled sex toys.

Check out this Gizmodo Article for a quick update: gizmodo: http://gizmodo.com/sorry-you-cant-have-any-more...

Background

Without warning, on July 20th, Comingle, and several other sex and tech companies (including Kickstarter and Vibease) unexpectedly had a suit filed against them.

This is all public knowledge and is listed here: https://search.rpxcorp.com/ent/955039-tzu-technologies-llc  .   Please peruse this for more information about the case and all the defendants involved.

 If I have incorrectly stated any facts from this case, it is my own fault, and Comingle should not be to blame. Here's what I have been able to discern.

The people bringing the suit are classified as a ""Non-Practicing Entity"" meaning they hold patents, but do not make anything themselves. These are the companies sometimes heard of pejoratively referred to as ""patent trolls.""

It seems that, according to them they have a patent (this one:  http://www.google.com/patents/US6368268 )  which they think applies to ANY sort of teledildonics operation. For instance, they argue that we are in violation by having a ""browser based platform for controlling the devices."" They have claims against a person remotely operating a toy with another person.

Unfortunately we are just a very small company just starting, and thus need as much help as we can get to try to defend ourselves from such attacks. So we are requesting your assistance to help save our open-technology.

More details in these articles:
Ars Technica: http://arstechnica.com/tech-policy/2015/07/tele...
Boingboing: http://bbs.boingboing.net/t/patent-troll-is-kil...
Metafetish: http://www.metafetish.com/2015/07/22/patent-troll-versus-everyone-teledildonics-patent-lawsuit/

How You Can Help

Here's the best way to help us right now:
• Share some money to our legal defense fund
• Help us find a pro-bono patent lawyer who would be willing to help us out with this case.
•  Help find prior art for computer, network, or internet controlled (sexual) stimulation devices. It needs to be items that

A) Existed and were publicly available

B) Are dated before August 1997.

column2: > Send findings to info@comingle.io and put ""Prior-Art"" in the subject.

column1: (More details on prior art: 35 USC 102 (https://www.law.cornell.edu/uscode/text/35/102) defines novelty as invalid if ""the claimed invention was patented, described in a printed publication, or in public use, on sale, or otherwise available to the public before the effective filing date of the claimed invention.”)

Here's a nice example:

CyberSM, The 2nd Experiment, 1993-94 from Kirk Woolford on Vimeo.
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >A patent suit requires TONS of money. Our lawyer friends said that it will be probably around $10,000 just to show up in court in California, and that patent suits typically require 300-500K of legal fees. We are getting quotes of 1 million plus! WHAT!!/??

Summary

The purpose of this  campaign is to raise $240,000 for the
acquisition and reconfiguration of the abandoned St. Croix Boys Camp –

creating Zen Camp MN.

The goal of Zen Camp is to become an outlet and education center with
focus on wilderness accessibility, sustainable living and holistic
wellness.
On Friday August 14th 2015 The Minnesota DNR held a sealed bid
auction for the property after reducing the minimum bid to $199,990.00.
Zen Camp founding director Matt Cavis submitted a bid of
$233,808.00 and won the winning bid.   10% of the total bid amount was due at the time of
the auction so Matt put all of his savings into that in
order to secure the bid. The balance of the bid is due in 90 days on November 12th, 2015.

The former camp resides on 81 acres and has sat vacant since 2006.  The old camp still has 18 buildings including living quarters, a dining hall, admin buildings and even a gym.  Many of the buildings will need updating- and will be reconfigured into more sustainable/ green designs.  The camp also features a climbing wall, baseball field, basketball court and 3000' of river front on the Tamarack River.
For more info please go to:
http://zencampmn.org/
What We Need

This campaign is to raise $240,000 for the property itself and closing costs.  The winning bid will become void on November 12, 2015 if the full bid amount is not paid to the Minnesota Department of Natural Resources.
Donated funds will fully go to the final payment for the property.  Should the goal of $240,000 not be met, the funds will still go to Zen Camp, we just may have to find a different property.
But lets not let that happen!  This property is amazing, it needs a new purpose.
Please Donate!!!
The Impact

Mission:
Provide education and outlets for wilderness experience, sustainable living, and conscious balanced wellness.

Vision:
Zen Camp is about balance and harmony in all aspects of life.  From how we live, what we eat, to how we interact with each other.  - All of these aspects can affect the people around us, our environment and our overall quality of life. In this respect we hope to create a nationally recognized center for better living through wilderness accessibility, truly sustainable living, and holistic wellness.
Zen Camp will feature the following:
Sustainable agriculture and livestock models
Reused and recycled building material
Re-purposed facilities into green spaces and self- sustained living models
Renewable energy such as solar, wind and geothermal
Yoga and Meditation retreats
Holistic wellness workshops
Classes in tai chi and capoeira
Sessions for massage therapy, reiki, and body works
Camping and day trips
Canoe shuttling and tours
Wilderness trips like hiking, biking and rock climbing
Every campsite will have an organic garden and solar power
Outdoor conservation education and workshops
Also many other activities and fund raising avenues are available-  wedding hosting, music events, private events, corporate team building retreats, training, tours, rentals -just to name a few!
Why Zen Camp?

What will make Zen Camp unique is that we believe in a balanced peaceful approach to all aspects in life - through having access to natural outdoor spaces, simple sustainable living and spiritual balance.
By combining the three pillars - wilderness, sustainability and wellness-  we can educate and share the tools needed to balance all aspects of life.  From how we live, what we eat, to how we
interact with each other.  All of these
aspects can affect the people around us, our environment and our overall
quality of life.
So please donate today!!!

""You may never know what results come of your action,
But if you do nothing there will be no result...
Be the change you want to see in the world.""
- Gandhi

Short Summary

As many of you know, my friends and I have always been interested in helping others - whether it's donating money, making sandwiches/backpacks and distributing them, collecting canned foods, etc. I decided that this summer, I'd like to tackle a new idea. I remember taking a Women's Rights class in college called, ""Women's Rights as Human Rights."" As we progressed through the quarter, we came upon the topic of women's rights and water. As I read about this topic, I began to realize that women travel very far to get a few liters of water. If they had a water well or pump in their village, they could spend that time going to school or contributing more to society. More information is given below, or you can check out this short article about how water is a basic human right: http://www.alternet.org/story/93903/.

The more I realize how important water is, the more I want to give back to other societies where water is not as affordable. So my thought was to fund a well - find a trusted organization (United Muslim Relief) and through them, build a well that will affect not only the women in that society, but everyone. One well can help build someone's future and I think it would be a blessing to be a part of that! Join me! Contribute whatever you can
column2:
you will definitely be rewarded for it!

What We Need &
column3:
What You Get
  • There are a few types of wells we could build through UMR right now. Most of them focus in Bangladesh, Pakistan, and Cambodia. The different types are Shallow tube wells, open surface well, shallow wells, shallow hand pump, etc. We will be building a Shallow Well in Pakistan for a total of $703.
column4:
>Dig a full well with UMR and we will get a personalized completion report within 8 months of our donation. Once the well is complete, we will receive a report from us which includes the location of the well as well as photographs of the well and a personalized plaque.

The Impact

column1: Women and Children

In Africa alone, people spend 40 billion hours every year walking for water. Women and children usually bear the burden of water collection, where they are forced to walk miles to the nearest water source, which is too often unprotected and contaminated. Time spent walking to collect water alongside illness from waterborne diseases keeps children from school and women from work. Along their walk, women are too often subjected to a greater risk of harassment and sexual assault. By providing safe water nearby, women are given the time to pursue new opportunities and improve the lives of their families.
Food Supply

Feeding the world uses up nearly 90% of the world’s freshwater withdrawals. When a well is built in a community, members can often use the new water source to grow small gardens near their homes and secure their own food supply.
Gender Equality

In most rural communities worldwide, women and young girls are responsible for walking to collect water for their families. Building a well nearby can give women the freedom to pursue an education or earn extra income.
http://umrelief.org/what-we-do/wash/

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign.
• Ask your parents, grandparents, neighbors, anyone! This is going for a good cause and you will be rewarded immensely!

Short Summary

My name is Dylan Michael Rowen. I am 13 years old and about to celebrate my Bar-Mitzvah. To mark this rite of passage, I am  giving back to my community with a ""Mitzvah Project"" to raise money for a cause that I believe in.

I have a deep passion for music, and the power that music has. I truly believe that music can make a difference in peoples lives. I recently learned that music is tool used to help aging adults who are suffering from Alzheimer's disease.
""When
used appropriately, music can shift mood, manage stress-induced
agitation, stimulate positive interactions, facilitate cognitive
function, and coordinate motor movements.""

I believe that I can make a difference by providing music for these individuals who otherwise would not have access to this type of therapy.

(Information from Alzheimer's Foundation of America Website www.alzfdn.org)
What We Need
I am raising $850.00 to purchase ipods and headphones for Alzheimer's
patients in my community. All proceeds will go to the Jewish and Family
Career Services Aviv Older Adult Services for Alzheimers patients.

The Impact

The impact of my Mitzvah Project will help allow aging Alzheimer patients who do not have resources otherwise, to utilize music as a meaningful therapy. This music will make them feel better, increase their cognitive function, and help stimulate their mind. Music can make a meaningful difference in peoples lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

To learn more about Music Therapy for Alzheimers patients please visit:
http://www.alzfdn.org/EducationandCare/musictherapy.html

To learn more about Jewish Family and Career Services Aviv Older Adult Programs visit:
https://yourtoolsforliving.org/services/older-adults

column6:
/>

The Problem: Kerosene Lanterns

When the sun goes down on the 5 million Ghanaians living off the power grid, they are forced to resort to kerosene lanterns to provide light. Kerosene lighting is:

Dangerous: Devastating house fires destroy wood/grass based homes. Parents can't leave children unattended for fear of serious burn injuries. 

Unhealthy: Breathing the poisonous smoke produced by kerosene is equivalent to smoking 2 packs of cigarettes a day.  Many rural homes are poorly ventilated and trap in fumes. 

Expensive: 15 Billion USD are spent in Africa each year on fuel-based lighting. Families are forced to pay recurring kerosene bills, costing up to 20% of their income. 

The Solution: The Sun King Pro 2  Solar Lamp
column14: >Compared to kerosene lanterns, solar lamps provide safer, cleaner, more affordable lighting. When families replace kerosene with solar, they experience doubled study hours for students, up to 30% increases in income, and better air quality. House fires disappear. Monthly kerosene costs vanish. Families are left with a warmer light where they can work, study, and play together in safety.

column4:
>We've partnered with the experienced international solar company Greenlight Planet to provide an affordable but high quality solar lamp designed to meet the needs of rural families. As bright as 15 kerosene lanterns, the Sun King Pro 2 offers 130 lumens of light. Its glow is soft on the eyes and easily lights a home. After a day's charge, it runs for up to 35hrs. Dual USB ports allow families to simultaneously charge two cellphones, a key feature for those living off-grid. Both the lamp and solar panel are shockproof, water resistant, and last for 5yrs with a 2yr warranty. Market research by one of our partners, PayGo Solar, shows that this lamp is the best suited product to meet Ghanaian needs at an affordable price. 

The Yenso Solar Model

We created Yenso Solar to find sustainable, long-term ways to deliver solar solutions to rural homes in Ghana. We are not a non-profit, but rather a social venture. A social venture combines the heart of a social worker with the mind of a businessman to create more innovative and effective impact. Once begun, Yenso Solar will be self-sustaining and will not rely on donations. Profits from the lamps will be reinvested into helping a larger audience and employing more Ghanaians. As a business venture, we are forced to constantly evaluate our performance and innovate to most efficiently create social good. 

Our current business model has been validated by in-country testing and by the experiences of our partners in other regions. Yenso Solar purchases lamps from manufacturers at wholesale price and distributes them through an innovative, 3-pronged sales strategy: direct sales to households and small businesses, partnerships with traveling salesmen who already travel to hard to reach areas, wholesale to credit unions who can provide financing. We also capitalize on the unique culture of remittances--richer city dwellers sending support back to their home villages. We are planning a targeted advertising campaign to market the Sun King Pro 2 as the gift every good son sends to his mother in the village. 

Your Impact

Every dollar donated will help bring light to a family in Ghana. Your support will provide opportunity for the future entrepreneurs, scientists and leaders of Africa. The money will be used to purchase a larger inventory of lamps, hire and train sales representatives, and offset the initial costs of starting an official business in Ghana.

column3: >(Data taken from lightingafrica.org and greenlightplanet.com)
column12:
>



","The Problem: Kerosene LanternsWhen the sun goes down on the 5 million Ghanaians living off the power grid, they are forced to resort to kerosene lanterns to provide light. Kerosene lighting is:Dangerous: Devastating house fires destroy wood/grass based homes. Parents can't leave children unattended for fear of serious burn injuries. Unhealthy: Breathing the poisonous smoke produced by kerosene is equivalent to smoking 2 packs of cigarettes a day.  Many rural homes are poorly ventilated and trap in fumes. Expensive: 15 Billion USD are spent in Africa each year on fuel-based lighting. Families are forced to pay recurring kerosene bills, costing up to 20% of their income. The Solution: The Sun King Pro 2  Solar LampCompared to kerosene lanterns, solar lamps provide safer, cleaner, more affordable lighting. When families replace kerosene with solar, they experience doubled study hours for students, up to 30% increases in income, and better air quality. House fires disappear. Monthly kerosene costs vanish. Families are left with a warmer light where they can work, study, and play together in safety.

A Simple Solution To A Complex Problem

WaterBots remove the uncertainty around your water supply.  They provide simple, easy to read indicators over the quality of your water in real-time.  

Much like TV or broadband in the past, water has a last mile problem.  We have an aging infrastructure that is inconsistent in terms of water quality.  Adding to the problem, man-made pollutants are typically colorless, odorless, tasteless, and rising in concentrations.  WaterBots put you in control.

By monitoring your water at the point of consumption, you are effectively seeing your water for the first time.    

About WaterBots

WaterBots connect water to the internet.  These physical devices measure real-time water quality.  Your phone or tablet receives this stream of data via the WaterBot app.

Which one is right for you?
<li>
WaterBot Pro:  If you have an existing drinking system like a reverse osmosis system, zero in on the Pro.  This dual-probed version is exactly what you need.
<li>
WaterBot Base: If you do not have a drinking system like a reverse osmosis system, the Base is exactly what you need.

How to Connect Your Water To The Internet

WaterBots are super easy to set-up.   They ship with connectors to adapt to most standard plumbing connections.  Add WiFi and you're good to go. 

WaterBots connect to your home or office's WiFi network in a snap.

The Bigger Picture

Here's where this gets cool.

WaterBots are also the physical front-end to the real-world.  Leveraging the unparalleled cognitive powers on IBM's cloud, here's the real deal:

We're crowdsourcing a massive amount of data for the thing that is only second to oxygen for human survival.

As we use IBM's cognitive cloud, this data creates an opportunity for some of the most impactful distributed studies the world has ever seen.

We agree with all the talk about infrastructure, but it is not rhetoric to us.  The water infrastructure is as bad or worse than the bridges.

As these WaterBots spread out through a distribution network, the power grows exponentially.  We will be open-sourcing this data for municipal use.  We can help them deliver quality and transparency if they choose.

 

OpenWaterQuality.org

WaterBots do more than just watch your water.  You can opt-out of anonymous sharing, but we hope you don't.

This is the cognitive cloud that makes us so excited for the IBM relationship.  

WaterBots communicate with the OpenWaterQuality.org database.  They can send your data, anonymously, to a central, open-sourced database.

Your water data can provide research organizations and universities with unprecedented data.  

We've built space-based telescopes to try and find water on other planets.  Yet we've never built a network to measure our quality on the planet we're actually on.

A WaterBot will protect your home's water quality.  A network of WaterBots will protect everyone's.

About Us

The notion of the WaterBot comes from 35 years of history at Water Doctors.

One of our founders, Bob Richter, started Water Doctors in 1982.  Water Doctors provides water treatment for homes, businesses and industry.

Water treatment has, quite literally for generations, relied on in-field measurements.  

Fellow co-founder of the WaterBot, Chris Richter, is Bob's son.  Chris conceived the idea of the WaterBots as a real-time peace of mind tool living within any home or business.
column2:
/>

Enter the third co-founder and robotics engineer, Edgar Duarte.  Chris and Edgar were there months ago when the water first started talking to the internet.  That was a pretty cool day.  Bigger, Edgar took the idea a level further.  It was Edgar's vision that converted WaterBots from great devices into one of the most powerful datasets ever assembled.

Let's measure everyone's water.  And open source that data.  

 

Our “Ask”

We'd like you to be a WaterBot Base.   The entire evolution of this project speaks to why.  Every single time that a new person has entered to help this project, it became more powerful.

Now we want you to join.

We'd like you to buy a device and connect it to your home's water supply.  We'd like you to choose to share that water quality data with OpenWaterQuality.org.

Yes, in the history of mankind, you'll be one of the first to have real-time insight into your water quality.  

But, you'll also be a key member of a small group of people who help create one of the most important databases ever built.

FAQ's

What do you mean by measuring my water quality?

All devices include measurements of total dissolved solids (TDS) and temperature.  TDS is used as a benchmark by both the EPA and World Health Organization.   

This is a sort of loose overview of the ranges of total dissolved solids.

What's unique about the device is the logging.  TDS in and of itself is of some value.  The ability to see trends is far more valuable.  The device allows for that.  Coupled with the Open Water Quality Project, the insight gets exponentially more valuable. 

If you have an existing reverse osmosis system, you'll want the dual-sensor edition.  This allows for measuring both the incoming water and drinking water quality.  As filters and membranes degrade, the system efficacy will drop.   

Does the device measure bacteria? 

No.  We're measuring physical properties of water
column3:
however, large changes in water chemistry can forecast other issues including bacteria. 

What about my privacy with a connected device?

You will have complete control over whether your device streams data to the Open Water Quality Project or not.  We hope you do.  Should you do so, all results will be anonymous.   

I love the Open Water Quality Project! Can I help you?

We are glad you do! The Open Water Quality Project can be something truly revolutionary. Water Quality is something that matters to everyone! We should be sure that the water that makes our bodies is great water.  The single-most important thing you can do is to deploy a WaterBot in your home.

Axis Freestyle Academy (AFA) is Canada's first all-in-one, year-round Dryslope Freestyle Training Facility dedicated to the progression of Ski and Snowboarding.

Our 20,000 sq.ft facility includes a Dryslope equipped with a variety of interchangeable jumps and rails, trampolines, foam pits and multi-purpose/yoga studio catered to athletes and enthusiasts no matter what your skill level.

column4: >Conveniently located just off hwy 400 in Vaughan, we are a 2 min drive (10 min walk) from Entrance 5 of Vaughan Mills Mall.  <
column6:
Click to Google Map us!

The key to progression and mastering tricks lies in practice and repetition.

column1:
AFA provides a year-round venue for athletes and enthusiasts to perfect their skills off the slopes while minimizing the inherent risks associated with freestyle sports.  

We promote health and wellness through physical activity while building the confidence to take it out on the snow and land those tricks.

With this fundraising we hope to create awareness and bring together a community for snow sport enthusiasts

This facility will be designed with all athlete levels in mind, from the beginner riders who have the ambition to ride in the terrain park to advanced riders training for competition.
Our Team:

We are a group that have been friends since highschool and came together to build a dream in hopes of inspiring others to believe in themselves and to achieve their truest potential.
We've been snowboarding for over 12 years, and now at age 32 we still have that drive and determination to further our skills.
<div>

<span><i>“It never fails that you progress through the season and just as you are able to add new tricks to your book the season’s over.  We have always wanted a place to train and improve year round, so we built one to share with others like us who have the same passion &amp
-

We feel like it is time to build within our community and create a facility where we can form lasting relationships with fellow riders, bring people together while progressing our skills.
-
This is not just a place for someone who wants to go pro, we are building this for everyone, no matter your riding level.

In addition to drop-ins and classes, we want to host events for our community from competitions to charity events and demo days.  We want to create an environment of positivity and encouragement.  Axis Freestyle would be our place to evolve our skills and continue to push the progression of our sport.

As you can all imagine, building this place is an expensive dream so all the help we can get is appreciated!  We've received lots of help and support from friends and family, but just a couple of average guys putting our hard-earned dollars into a passion.

Short Summary
My name is Dena Goldberg and I am working on
my Master's at UC Irvine in Genetic Counseling. Now, what is genetic
counseling? Chances are you have never heard of this career. If you have, you
probably think it has something to do with making designer babies. This
misconception is very far from the truth, and is one of the reasons I am doing
this project.
The problem is that many people going through
medical odysseys trying to find a diagnosis and seeing doctor after doctor to
find out what is wrong with them have never been referred to genetics, and most
doctors have little to no training in genetics. So many people with genetic
disorders have never been diagnosed because no one ever sent them to a genetics
clinic. The only way to change this is to raise AWARENESS and EDUCATE people
about genetics in their own medical care.
This project will capture the current
knowledge and opinions of the general public towards genetic counseling and
find ways to increase awareness through education initiatives.
What We Need &
<ul>
<li>I am asking for
funding to cover all of the materials needed for this project including:
<ul>
• Booth space at events and expos
• Event Rentals (table, chair, wi-fi, electric)
• 2 Posters
• Flyers/pamphlets
• Giveaways to promote participation
• URL for survey
• Analysis software
• Travel Expenses
• Etc.
<li>This type of
study has never been done in the United States, and I believe it will be
useful to show how genetics can be brought to the public eye.
<li>I am a graduate
student and have no source of income. I applied for a few grants, but did not
receive any so I decided to try crowd-funding.
The Impact
As genetic counselors, we see patients for a
variety of reasons in multiple settings. We may see pregnant women with an
increased risk for a birth defect or genetic disorder such as Down syndrome. We
may see a child with autism that has never been explained, or a person with
multiple medical problems that don't make sense. We may see patients at risk for
one of the rare types of cancer that run in families, or a patient deciding
whether to get early testing for an adult-onset form of disease. Technically, every
person could benefit from seeing a genetic counselor at some point in his or
her life, but most people don't know we exist.
By increasing awareness
<ul>
<li>
More people would
know to ask about seeing a genetic counselor or to self-refer
<li>
More people would
have a diagnosis, and therefore a better medical plan
<li>
A person with a
known genetic change could learn about his or her options before having
children
<ul><li>A person with a
specific diagnosis would know what other medical problems to look for at
different stages in lifeOne of the
educational interventions I’m currently making is a comic strip I created starring
a cartoon genetic counselor. (denadna.com)
Risks &
<ul>
<li>The biggest
challenge with this project will be getting a representative population sample.
I plan to conduct my research at various public events, but most of them
cost money, which is where you come in.
<li>A higher budget
means a higher number of participants I will be able to survey, and the
more useful my results will be.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that
doesn't mean they can't help:
<ul>
<li>Even if you
can’t contribute, please help me get the word out about this project by
sharing this site and/or the video anywhere you can- even if that means
only sending it to one person- every little bit counts!
<li>Don’t forget to
use the Indiegogo share tools!
<li>Follow me on
twitter @DenaTalksDNA
<li>The whole
purpose of this project is to spread awareness about genetic counseling. At
the very least, make yourself aware of what genetic counseling is.
Thank you so much!

Event Rentals (table, chair, wi-fi, electric)
2 Posters
Flyers/pamphlets
Giveaways to promote participation
URL for survey
Analysis software
Travel Expenses
Etc.
This type of
study has never been done in the United States, and I believe it will be
useful to show how genetics can be brought to the public eye.
I am a graduate
student and have no source of income. I applied for a few grants, but did not
receive any so I decided to try crowd-funding.
The Impact
As genetic counselors, we see patients for a
variety of reasons in multiple settings. We may see pregnant women with an
increased risk for a birth defect or genetic disorder such as Down syndrome. We
may see a child with autism that has never been explained, or a person with
multiple medical problems that don't make sense. We may see patients at risk for
one of the rare types of cancer that run in families, or a patient deciding
whether to get early testing for an adult-onset form of disease. Technically, every
person could benefit from seeing a genetic counselor at some point in his or
her life, but most people don't know we exist.
By increasing awareness
More people would
know to ask about seeing a genetic counselor or to self-refer
More people would
have a diagnosis, and therefore a better medical plan
A person with a
known genetic change could learn about his or her options before having
children
A person with a
specific diagnosis would know what other medical problems to look for at
different stages in lifeOne of the
educational interventions I’m currently making is a comic strip I created starring
a cartoon genetic counselor. (denadna.com)
Risks & Challenges
The biggest
challenge with this project will be getting a representative population sample.
I plan to conduct my research at various public events, but most of them
cost money, which is where you come in.
A higher budget
means a higher number of participants I will be able to survey, and the
more useful my results will be.
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that
doesn't mean they can't help:
Even if you
can’t contribute, please help me get the word out about this project by
sharing this site and/or the video anywhere you can- even if that means
only sending it to one person- every little bit counts!
Don’t forget to
use the Indiegogo share tools!
Follow me on
twitter @DenaTalksDNA
The whole
purpose of this project is to spread awareness about genetic counseling. At
the very least, make yourself aware of what genetic counseling is.
Thank you so much!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Orange, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/genetic-counseling-awareness-project/pica

column3:
>Dearest Friends, Family and Kindhearted Strangers,  

Our fellow friend (and for those who don't know him - a truly compassionate person!) Christian Alexander has been battling an excruciating chronic facial nerve pain condition for more than four years now
column4:
this condition is known to be one of the worst pains to endure due to its complexity and location. Christian is nearly paralyzed and nonfunctional with this pain, so it is absolutely necessary that he receive treatment. Christian has been doing everything within his own and his family's resources to find a treatment, up until a few months ago. This is when Christian opened up to close friends, which have been aware of Christian's condition for some time. Now, Christian is opening up to the larger family, friends, community and network of big hearts in hopes that we can join forces to assist him in continuing his present efforts to find a cure.  

In late November 2014, a wonderful small group within our community joined minds to create an initial plan for Christian. This opened a huge window of opportunity, which put Christian on three months of private medical insurance and gave him access to specialists that otherwise would have been impossible to see with his current government insurance plan
column5:
most notably, the new insurance has also expedited the search for his cure immensely.    

Since enrolling in the private medical system, Christian has been remarkably proactive in seeing four specialists, among whom were two exceptional ones including a pain management specialist and a neurologist.

column3:
> ABOUT THIS CROWD FUNDING PROJECT:  

By the end of January 2015, Christian’s private insurance will be discontinued unless the monthly premium funds are paid. This is the main reason Christian is coming to you—the community at large—in hopes that we can combine our funds and enable him to continue scheduling all the necessary appointments with these exceptional specialists—and ultimately find his cure or at least a sustainable plan of pain relief.  Based on an assessment by a medical expert within our community, Christian needs a ballpark figure of:

6 more months of private insurance to achieve this goal, which in addition to the three months that have passed, would cost:

$8100 in private insurance fees (approx. $900 a month) 

Raising this amount would:
>a) give him access to specialists needed for this type of condition
column4:
he is using his government insurance for medications.  

b) provide him with experimental and breakthrough treatment options (which will rarely be covered by government insurance).  

c) the ultimate hope is recovery within 6 months or sooner
column5:
otherwise Christian’s disabilities process will be in place to continue covering the cost of his insurance.

What has motivated Christian to keep going daily are his passions for DJing and personal training, his daily exercises, his friendships, his sheer willpower and his prescribed medications (which only mask 10 percent of the pain). Since he was struck with this debilitating condition, Christian has had to learn how to function in a new way
column6:
most notably, he has been bound by a strict schedule that greatly limits his capabilities. Because Christian is only able to function at 25 percent of his normal potential, his condition has proven to keep him from producing a sustainable income, which his skill sets would normally provide.

SUMMARY OF CHRISTIAN'S RECENT EFFORTS: 

•
column13: > The pain management specialist's initial overview was that Christian's pain may involve the trigemenal nerve, so he performed a few diagnostic ""nerve block"" injections
column14:
his ultimate goal was to identify and freeze the nerve. The doctor also suggested that Christian perform an MRI.

•
column21:
> The doctor referred Chrisitian to a neurosurgeon and neurologist, so they can all use their collective minds to find a cure. 

•
column28:
> The neurologist was the most compassionate, informative and out-of-the-box thinking specialist Christian has consulted with. She has developed a plan, which includes brand new experimental medications and innovative injections to treat his atypical facial nerve pain. Overall, she's definitely the type of specialist we need on our side to help us find a cure.

REWARDS:   

By backing this project, Christian would extend his gratitude by sharing his ability in the following:

•
column35:
> A message of gratitude on his website...if you give $5

•
column42:
> 1 ticket to a phone seminar about motivation and willpower...if you give $25 

•
column49:
> 1-hour assisted stretching session... if you give $50

•
column56:
> 1-hour mixology consultation on how to create + present complex mixed drinks... if you give $100

•
column63:
> 3 DJ technical skill lessons... if you give $250

•
column70:
> 10 tennis lessons... if you give $500

•
column77:
> 20 sessions of personal fitness training... if you give $1000

•
column84:
> 2 private DJ events in New York... if you give $1200 

Note: All rewards may be adjusted or rearranged according to the backer's liking.

Also, it's important to note that upon his recovery, Christian intends to be an ambassador for those suffering with facial nerve pain by sharing his story and inspiring others to never lose hope. So let us join our resources to heal this friend and peaceful warrior!

PHOTOGRAPHER / Diego Tabango

For the second year in a row, both Kansas Quidditch and the Baby Jays (more commonly known as the Crimson Warhawks) have qualified for World Cup! From the club's start with 12 players to our program now of over 50 athletes has been a long journey, and we couldn't be more proud of where we are at. However, there is always room to improve, and sending both traveling teams to World Cup 8 is a fantastic learning experience for everyone, from the most experienced members to the new freshmen. As excited as we are, there are multiple costs for traveling across the country, from airfare to hotel fees, and even things as simple as food and water during the tournament. To help combat the costs, we have listed a variety of perks to select from to thank everyone for their contributions! For a few of the perks, you'll need to select a team member to volunteer as tribute. All participating members for the specific perks have their picture and some information in the Updates section of the page. Any amount at all helps, and as always, Rock Chalk!

For any specifics on orders, regarding a specific player as a volunteer or color schemes for other perks, either message Austin Pitts on Facebook with the details or leave a comment on this page. Thanks!

Money will be used to develop the simulator frame further and bring to market quicker. If you have any interest in seeing how this can develop, please donate at least a $1 to show your interest and support. Thank you!

We have owned or tested nearly every other cockpit available and see the need for a more adjustable cockpit with telescoping steering wheel mount and adjustable vertical pedal positioning. Why can’t one simulator frame quickly and easily adjust between F1 driving position, Indycar, Formula, Prototype, GT3-Cup, Endurance, Nascar, or ANY other racing position? Why can’t one frame comfortably fit ANY size driver? Be comfortable while you are race simulator training and don’t hurt your back, neck, wrists, knees, ankles, eyes etc. Whether you are 4-foot tall or 8-foot, you can quickly and easily adjust to your perfectly desired seating position.

Use our recommended seats or easily mount your own race seat. Easily mount any wheel, pedals, or shifters.

As mentioned in video, we have 3 different vertical pedal positioning systems (not shown) that were quite heavy in steel, so we are almost ready with them in aluminum. The shown spacer blocks in the video under pedals were for height demonstration only, not final product.

DRT Simulators has been researching and developing racing and flight simulators for 5-years now. If we are headed in the right direction, please show your support and help us develop it faster. Thank you!

https://www.facebook.com/pages/DRT-Racing-Simul...

http://www.drtsimulators.com/

Who is Khensani
Mokhari?
Khensani Mokhari is a thoughtful,
respectful and responsible young woman who lives with her parents and 2 sisters
in Diepsloot, a township on the outskirts of Johannesburg. In Grade 8, Khensani
was awarded a scholarship to a private girls’ boarding school outside of
Johannesburg. From the time of her arrival, Khensani worked consistently,
involved herself in a wide range of activities and was an active participant in
all her classes. In 2013, Khensani’s quiet leadership style was recognized and
she was elected to represent her grade on the Student Representative Council.
An incident that
would change her life forever.
Khensani started her Grade 10 year with the
same energy and commitment and she looked set to have another good year.
However, in June 2014, she reported to the nurses on campus that she was
struggling with headaches and some visual problems. She was referred to an
ophthalmologist who found that something was pushing on the optic nerve. An MRI
revealed that she had a very large tumour (7.75 x 6 x 4.5 cm) in the left
ventricle of her brain that was pushing on her optic nerve. The neurosurgeon
who was called in to consult was very clear she would have to have the tumour
removed despite the risks of surgery. The alternative was that Khensani would
live for approximately 6 more months during which time she would go blind and
gradually become paralysed.
Khensani was referred to the Paediatric
Oncology Unit at the Charlotte Maxeke Johannesburg Academic Hospital (CMJAH)
where she was diagnosed with a rare, multi-system genetic condition called
tuberous sclerosis which causes benign tumours to grow in the brain and other
organs.
Khensani was started on treatment for her
underlying condition and she was booked for surgery to remove the tumour.
Complications of her
operations.
Khensani’s condition deteriorated rapidly and
she started having seizures after 5 days on the treatment. She was taken immediately
to the Wits Donald Gordon Medical Centre in Johannesburg where a CT scan
revealed that the tumour had continued to grow very quickly and was almost
completely obstructing the cerebrospinal fluid.
On 20 June 2014, Khensani underwent
emergency surgery to insert an external drain in order to relieve the pressure
and stop the seizures.  The next day, she
went into theatre again
column2: this time for a 7 hour surgery to remove the tumour.

column1: Khensani was recovering well in the Intensive Care unit, until, 3 days after
the surgery, she developed an infection and developing swelling in the brain.
She had 2 more surgeries
column2: to relieve the pressure and then to have an internal

column1: catheter inserted.
Khensani’s recovery after the final surgery
was much slower. While this could be expected after four brain surgeries in 10
days, it also emerged that Khensani had lost most of her vision in both eyes as
a result of the invasive nature of the surgeries. She also had some facial
nerve palsy and did not have full use of her arms and legs.
Khensani’s Recovery.
She underwent intensive rehabilitation to
regain her gross and fine motor control and to monitor her progress in terms of
regaining her vision. She and her family also received counselling to assist
them to manage through this time. Unfortunately, her vision has not improved at
all. Assessments by the staff at the rehab centre have been confirmed by a
specialist optometrist and Khensani is now considered to be functionally blind.
This meant that, in addition to the many other
losses and adjustments Khensani has had to manage, she was unable to return to
the mainstream school to which she had won a scholarship. Instead it was
necessary to find her a school that could assist her with developing the kinds
of skills that she will need in order to function effectively in the world as a
person with a visual impairment. Fortunately, Khensani was admitted as a weekly
boarder into Prinshof School for the Visually Impaired in Pretoria.
Khensani has adapted incredibly well to her
new environment where she has endeared herself to the staff with her
willingness to adapt, her sense of humour and her determination to achieve her
goals in spite of her disability. In an email about Khensani’s transition, the Prinshof
Head of Occupational Therapy noted:
Khensani misses her old school and
everyone there very much, but she seems to have adapted well to Prinshof School
and hostel. She still gets lost at times, but her wonderful sense of humour
helps her to overcome her loss of vision. She says that she had to accept her
visual impairment quickly because life was not going to stop and wait for her
to do so and she does not want to miss out on anything at all.
This really captures something about
Khensani’s spirit!
Help support. Give
Khensani a better future.
The BrailleNote Apex is essentially a
laptop for visually impaired people with built-in, smart technology. The
computer is very expensive at R70 000 but according to the staff at
Prinshof it is revolutionising education and learning for those with visual
impairments, making studying easier and more interactive. It is 99.9% similar
to a laptop with a daily planner, access to email and internet. There is a
media centre for radio, a scientific calculator and a built-in chat function.
It has a braille terminal and, at the school, is connected to a computer screen
for the teachers to follow what the learners are doing. It can also be
connected to a smart phone.
Please could you consider making a
contribution to the cost of purchasing a BrailleNote Apex for Khensani. You
would be contributing to the further education of a bright, determined,
responsible, grateful and thoughtful young woman who has the potential and the
fighting spirit to make a significant difference in the world.

Jabz handwraps is the first product for Jabz -- a company dedicated to producing fun and funky (kick)boxing apparel and gear for women.

For those of you who need Handwrap 101, handwraps are narrow strips of slightly stretchy fabric with a thumb loop on one end and hook-and-loop closure at the other.  You wrap around your wrists, hands and fingers so you don't break a wrist when you get a good shot in at your opponent (even if your opponent is a punching bag).
These handwraps are made of a cotton-nylon blend that provides some stretch, and are available in:
<ul>
• Zany Zebra (zebra print)
• Wild Thing (cheetah print)
• English Garden (blue floral)
• Let's Polka (sky blue and white polka dots)

The samples you see in the video (and below) are produced by the same people that will make your handwraps, all I need is your go-ahead!

I am creating this fundraiser to help my bestfriend with her medical bills that she incurred after a horrible wreck that almost took her from us.

She was in a wreck at the beginning of August (which they first called a fatality). She was rushed to the hospital with internal bleeding, head trauma, broken ribs, and some crushed vertebrae in her back.  She was in the ICU at the hospital for a week before she gained consciousness.  She then spent the next month going through surgeries and numerous physical and occupational therapy sessions.  When she was in the wreck, she broke a bone in her ear that makes her almost 100% deaf on the left side.  After a month in the hospital, she was released and is now at home recovering. She is still having issues hearing even with hearing aids and is waiting to see if surgery will improve this.  This has been a struggle for her, her family, and everyone that loves her.  I know this is one of the hardest things she has ever had to go through.
She is a mother to 2 awesome little boys and had recently gotten married (2 weeks before her wreck).  I honestly cant describe in words how much her and her family mean to me.
The picture of the vehicle is what the Ford F150 she was driving looked like after her wreck.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute, please share this fundraiser and get the word out!
Thanks

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><span class=""notranlsate""><span class=""notranlsate""><span class=""notranlsate""><span class=""notranlsate""><blockquote>

I hope you will join me in helping ""Momma Norma,"" as she is known to the children she has nannied over the years, and providing hope as she recovers her health. With prayers and positivity reaching her from around the world, I've no doubt she will bounce back from this with the holistic beauty and grace for which she's known and so very loved.

Meet Norma. She's a 67-year-old all-around amazing woman - my mother, my best friend, the reason I'm in this country today living out her American Dream, and now, a colon cancer survivor. She has been in the ICU at Mount Sinai Medical Center in Miami Beach since Sept. 23, 2013, following an extremely unexpected colon resection after detection of a tumor, a surgery that sadly ended with her body going into septic shock, sending five her of systems into acute failure. She has fought for every single function since, making admirable progress day after day thanks to formidable baby steps. The first time she opened her eyes and told me she loved me after being on a ventilator for 10 days is a moment I will never forget.

Prior to this incident, my mom's prior hospitalizations had been to birth my brother and me, and the only pills she took were the occasional Aleve or Advil to ease a headache or knee pain. Undoubtedly, going through this alongside my mom has opened my eyes to all that we too often take for granted. Certainly, I never expected to see my mom in such conditions and most certainly, not so suddenly.

Her resilience, her strength and her determination have made me prouder than I've ever been to be her daughter. While I have always known her to be brave, I could've never imagined her in the face of this type of adversity. Yet, every morning, she welcomes me with a smile
column2: she's sweet and kind to her medical team
column3: and she stays focused despite feeling the pains she feels on a daily basis, which include intensive physical therapy and continuous dialysis.

column1: Her attitude is not surprising, however. My mom has always been the most beautiful of people. In her late 40s, she backed my dad's decision to come to the U.S. in search for a better future for my brother and me, leaving behind not only her beloved Buenos Aires but also her entire family. Since, she has worked every single day to ensure our happiness her, motivating us to live out our American Dream, to be better, to aim higher, to be happier.

Unfortunately, the time, effort and money my parents spent on ensuring their children's future didn't go far ensuring theirs. They don't own a home or a car and live modestly on my mom's nannying wages. As my dad's mental health deteriorated over the past couple of years, he has remained unemployed, making my mom the breadwinner and the backbone of their home.

That backbone has now been resting on a hospital bed for more than a month, and the more aware she becomes of time, the more she realizes its financial impact. While she is covered, to a certain extent, by Medicaid, everyday life has been adding up quickly, with insufficient funds for rent and utilities. While I have been able to offer some assistance, spending the entire month with my dad and her, I fall short in providing for them, particularly as I await my husband's homecoming after a 10-month deployment with the U.S. Navy.
They say God does not give us what we can't handle. I keep reassuring myself that we must be stronger than we've ever given ourselves credit for.

column2: >I hope you will join me in helping ""Momma Norma,"" as she is known to the children she has nannied over the years, and providing hope as she recovers her health. With prayers and positivity reaching her from around the world, I've no doubt she will bounce back from this with the holistic beauty and grace for which she's known and so very loved.

column1: On behalf of my mom, dad and brother, I thank you for your time spent reading this and for your consideration. I can assure you that your generosity, both in donations and in prayers, will not go by unnoticed. I will provide you all with updates on her condition along the way, and I'm hopeful that she will be thanking you personally very soon.

A heartfelt thank you,
Valeria
