Pictured above is Kerry with actor, singer, dancer and writer John Barrowman, who visited her in hospital.
Kerry Robertson
Kerry, 19, has been diagnosed with oral cancer, and her life has changed forever.

Kerry Robertson, throughout her life, has taken a great interest in helping and caring for people around her. She has a huge involvement in looking after her grandmother and helping her mother look after her younger siblings. Her bubbly personality and great sense of humour has made her very popular, and her future ambitions revolved around helping and caring for people.

Not too long ago, Kerry had complained of a mouth ulcer to her dentist, which had been bothering her for a few weeks. The dentist, after examining the ulcer, suggested Kerry visit her doctor, which she did at the first opportunity. The doctor, to Kerry's frustration, sent her back to the dentist, who had told her they could not do anything to help alleviate her pain and discomfort in her case. This carried on for a number of weeks and Kerry's concerns increased until she could visit the dental hospital, which referred her to Glasgow's Southern General Hospital which, ultimately, diagnosed her with oral cancer.

Unfortunately, Kerry was at a stage where the cancer had spread, and she underwent operations to remove the most afflicted areas. Kerry lost her tongue, sections of her mouth and parts of her voice box. She is awaiting the commencement of radiotherapy and chemotherapy, and there are plans to rebuild her tongue using muscle tissue from her leg, but Kerry is coming to terms with the fact she will be on a liquid diet for the rest of her life, and her voice, a key part of her positive and bubbly personality, will never be the same again.

Kerry, since October 2011, has been a part of the McDonald's restaurant based on Renfrew Road, Paisley, where she is a hard-working and highly-respected member of staff. She also recently attended college where she took a course in working with children with special needs. She was due to start further education in James Watt College after the summer, but, due to her circumstances, can no longer carry out her studies.
Thank you very much for reading this appeal for Kerry, and if you can donate in any way, please do so as generously as you can, anything is appreciated.

Short Summary

On May 8, 2012 Kyle Carpenter was dirt-bike riding at the Comp Edge MX Track. While riding about a ninety foot jump, he overcharged it, and when spotting nearby people, winded up ditching the dirt bike. Unfortunately, this caused a tragic, terrible accident.

Soon after the loss of feeling in his legs and immense pain in his arm, Kyle was airlifted to the Arrowhead hospital. It was confirmed that the accident caused a broken arm and a broken spine. Some of the bones were completely shattered, leaving the surgeon to remove part of Kyle's hipbones to help repair his back when finally undergoing surgery. Kyle's wrist, on the other hand, now contains plates, pins, and screws that will be removed in about six weeks. All in all, the results from the surgery were, thankfully, good.

A few days after the surgery, Kyle was transferred to another hospital. Although he is already on his way to a road of recovery, there are hospital bills and rehabilitation bills that cannot go unpaid.
<div>
The Impact
The goal of this fundraiser is to help lessen the burden on the Carpenter family. Help us contribute to Kyle's Road to Recovery!
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
<ul>
• Spread the word!

Short Summary

A friend of Leah’s who wants to remain anonymous has offered a challenge to all of Leah’s friends and supporters. For every dollar you donate, they will match it dollar for dollar till we reach our goal of $3000, so tell your friends about Leah’s love and how her light  shines for all of us and ask them to help, knowing there’s another friend ready to match their donation.
This Is Leah Elizabeth Rivera.  She is eleven months old and such a good baby.She is ALWAYS smiling
column2: it is rare that anyone will see her cry.  Unfortunately, Leah was diagnosed with retinoblastoma on May 31st of this year.  Retinoblastoma is a rare, cancerous tumor of a part of the eye called the retina.  It is so rare that four out of a million kids are diagnosed with this cancer a year.  On June 14th Leah had to undergo surgery and have her eye removed, hopefully that’s the worst that Leah will have to go through.  We will shortly find out if the cancer has spread and if it’s genetic.   We are praying that Leah does not have to go through chemo and that it’s not genetic.  Leah’s parents, Kelly and Anthony are both hard working, young, loving parents.  Leah is their first and only child.  Kelly had to take a leave of absence in order to give her full attention to Leah.  Although Leah has insurance, Kelly and Anthony have to pay co-pays and deductibles.  We are asking you to donate a small portion so they are able to pay Leah’s bills.  They would be so incredibly thankful.  If you are not able to donate, a prayer would help and would be appreciated.  Thank you for taking the time to read this.

Erin Erikson is an amazing person who is always willing to help, she has taken people in her home, offers support, rides, assistance, a shoulder to cry on and always some off the wall joke.

In May of this year she underwent knee surgery, thinking that her job benefits would cover her wages while she was out of work. The insurance company paid the first portion then denied the second part, which is still in appeal until October 1, 2012.

Erin since having the surgery has had loss of wages, her car has died due to a transmission failure, and has been struggling with food boxes, extentions on bills, and yet still keeps a smile on her face.
It is my thought that people who know her, or her family could help her out. There are 3 ways in which I am asking people to help.
1) Prayer - I always feel that a good word to the big guy upstairs never can hurt anyone

2) Donation - She has a paypal account under EErikson@mail.com or for those who wish to take the route of bank deposit you can always email me at jeffpran@yahoo.com and I can give you her account information.

3) Unwated items - I am putting together a yardsale for her and would love to have more things to sell, so I am asking everyone if you have unwanted items to please bring them over to Erin's house...remember ""one man's trash is anothers treasure"".

If you know Erin you would know that she is someone who helps everyone she comes across with a smile, meal, kind word, or place to stay...now is when she needs the help and its time to look into your heart and ask..what have you done to help someone today..

Thank you for allowing me to share with you guys
A little about myself, I am a graduate of University Of The Nations, (better known as Y.W.A.M.) Youth with A Mission.
Thats my dad Charlie, he is a UCLA graduate with a BA in engineering and has always held a steady job, always been a great father and mentor to my family.
My dad is really just a straight up awesome guy, always willing to help with anything , sometimes has horrible jokes, but always a loving family man and the foundation to our family.
What happened and why its urgent we get your help.
Charlie had two strokes within three days early on this year, since then he has been in recovery since February 4th,2012 , the day was my moms birthday.
He has been in a hospital bed in Tapei,Taiwan since February and has not been able to come home.

Paralyzed and mostly unresponsive on some days he requires the most extreme treatments. He needs constant around the clock hospital care which is quite expensive without insurance, which he doesn't have anymore.

I need to raise this money ASAP to get over there and make sure he is getting everything he needs to be back on the road to recovery. To be sure he is getting 100% the best treatment to recovery. He's my dad and I love him to death!

My dad needs to hear familiar voices, stroke victims usually go brain dead or unresponsive, but they are just in a dream state. They can hear still and usually need to hear loved ones voices to get out of that zone and get better. I need to be there to help him!
Please help make that possible and contribute so i can get over to Taiwan!!
This whole family has alot to lose without your help!
Friends, family, and online community please help!
What may seem small or nothing will really make a difference!
Charlie has two young step brothers of mine. Ages 2 and 4=[

They will be growing up without a dad, so ill do my best to cover that area. But at this moment i really need YOU to help , if you are already spending the time to read this to help contribute any thing you can!
Please give what you can , every little bit helps! For those of you who cant donate, you can contribute by sharing the link above as well as sharing with family and friends.
Thank you for your support guys! Please help be a blessing to this family, with your prayers and contributions it would mean so much to us!
Thanks so much!
Stephen Huang
GOD BLESS!

They will be growing up without a dad, so ill do my best to cover that area. But at this moment i really need YOU to help , if you are already spending the time to read this to help contribute any thing you can!
Please give what you can , every little bit helps! For those of you who cant donate, you can contribute by sharing the link above as well as sharing with family and friends.
Thank you for your support guys! Please help be a blessing to this family, with your prayers and contributions it would mean so much to us!
Thanks so much!
Stephen Huang

PLEASE WATCH THE VIDEO LINK ABOVE
AFTER CAMPAIGN, PLEASE SEE: www.webbedpaddles.com
This product design project combines mechanical engineering, evolutionary biology, and modern material capabilities.
We have designed the Shearwater to be 3 things:
<ul>
<li>a practical application of ‘biomimicry' (copying nature's engineering / efficiency)
<li>a uniquely compact paddle adaptable for a variety of water sports (webbed blade folds inward, and shaft breaks down for storage and transport)
• an educational tool for science centers, camps, and parks.

Working prototypes have been made, but with the key center or throat part in solid, CNC-machined aluminum. In order to make the Shearwater accessible and lighter, our project goal is to get enough support to have tooling made for the unique pieces, and place an initial material order for the other components.
Express yourself: webs will be made of thick, strong PVC material, in a color of your choice by Alberta Tent &
column2: Awning.  A backer option is for your web to be made from RECYCLED fabric, similar to this Swiss company's heavy-duty products: http://www.freitag.ch/about/production

column1: Black fiberglass shafts will be standard, for a warmer feel warm on the hands.  For Canoe and SUP Shearwaters, a special top grip has been chosen.

When collapsed, Shearwater paddles fit in a 3"" (8cm) wide tube!  When quickly assembled, they behave in the water much like rigid recreational paddles, but with less disturbance than most.  Perfect trailing tip spiral vortexes are generated, as is a very slight blade flex and whip effect to smooth thrust, both just like with birds' feet (see Science diagram in the video).  You can see some testing photos under the Gallery tab above, and videos at this link: http://www.youtube.com/user/BiomimeticPaddle/videos

Please note that the paddle pre-sale prices are a bit higher than we had hoped.  It is not so easy to mimic nature and custom-build!  These paddles involve a number of pieces, different North American suppliers and, while very compact, still become a relatively long package to ship to you.
This project is ""All or Nothing"" - if we don't meet our Goal, we can't produce and send out the paddles (your contribution will be refunded). So, please get your friends involved!

Thanks for your interest, and we are happy to answer any questions.

5/1 UPDATE

Our Story

My name is Sigi Nissimov. I have a loving husband Jack and we are the proud parents of two great kids, Kai, age 11 and Tia, age 9. I am a professional bellydancer and I own and operate Life Movement Spirit and Dance Center for children and adults in Fair Lawn NJ.

About a year and half ago I was diagnosed with Adrenal Cancer, an extremely rare cancer for which there is no cure. The doctors at Sloan Kettering offered me surgery and chemo as my best chance of prolonging my life but even then they weren't giving me much time, maybe a  year at best. I did what they told me to do. I went and had surgery to have the tumor removed and I went thru 6 grueling rounds of chemotherapy.
I really do not want to discuss my personal details of chemo but I am sure all of you can imagine the emotional distress, pain and suffering that my family and I went through during this trying time.
I tried to live my life normally each day while tending to my family and career. If the doctors were right I was going to try and enjoy every moment i had left.

Last August, during one of my routine monthly checkups, it was discovered that my cancer had returned. I asked my local oncologist what that meant  and I was told the prognosis was not good. At best I was told I had 3-6 months to live and there was nothing they could do for me.

We flew out to the University of Michigan where they specialize in this type of cancer. Their prognosis was not much better. They could offer another surgery and more chemo and at best gain another few months. They told me there was no cure and other than a miracle there was nothing more they can do.
The Angel of Death came forward into my life that day and I began feeling it next to me, walking in my shadow
I did not know what to think, how to understand what was being told to me. My senses became numb. I began to feel mute, blind and helplessly crippled in my own body and soul.
How for Gods sake could I begin to move forward and acknowledge what to do, how to feel, how to talk how to accept this fate?
Along the journey of life we experience and are taught many things
In the school of life they teach us to laugh
In the school of life they teach us how to be angry and how to cry
In the school of life they teach us to learn from others and to learn from our mistakes
But did Mom and Dad ever talk about death??
Does anyone ever teach us how to die??
Why do I tell you all do this? So that you can feel me in your hearts. Cases like mine happen all the time, but we always say this can not be happening to me.

In the realm of angels, two came hand in hand to visit me after that dreadful day. One was the Angel of Death and the other was very special angel, a bright light of hope. I could either accept my fate or fight to change it.
Who says we can't change fate?? Just because Western medicine says i only have a few months left does that mean i should give up and accept it?

With the help of family and friends I decided not to give up but to fight..I was directed to holistic organizations, sent to Chinese herbal doctors who have had success in prolonging peoples life years past their diagnosed dates. I was directed to eat certain organic foods. People held fundraisers for me and I was able to see a therapist to help me cope mentally with all that was going on.
I decided to change the story of this deadly cancer into a miracle story..against all odds!!!
I was able to breathe again!!!.
<div>
The Impact

In order to pursue the alternative treatments I need to stop working and focus full time of my recovery. We cut as much as we could from our daily living expenses but in the end there is not enough at the end of the month to pay our bills. And that's before we factor in the cost of all the different treatments I am trying. The stress of worrying about money is taking my focus away of what should be my only job..healing myself so I can be around to watch my kids grow up. I want my kids to feel like nothing is wrong so we are trying to keep them enrolled in after school activities as best as we can but that costs money as well. Any money that will be raised will go towards one purpose and and one purpose only..It will allow me to go out and try all different kind of alternative therapies that have worked for other people. Infra red saunas, herbal medicines,  specific diets based on blood chemtisty etc etc.  I know that I am on the right path andy Im planning to do everything so I can be with my family.
<div>

Any money raised will go to helping me survive longer. There are stories of people who have tried these alternative ways and have lived decades longer than what they were told. I need to buy all organic foods, I need to pay the bio chemist who is monitoring my blood levels, i need to fly to see the Chinese doctor who is advising me on what herbal medicines I should be taking. I need to buy those herbal medicines which can run up to $1000 per month. Part of the therapy is sitting in an infra red sauna twice a day for 1/2 hour at a time. On top of that I need the kids to have after school routines so that they feel life is normal and all is well. If i can eliminate the stress of worrying how to pay for my treatments than i can focus on actually getting better. The doctors say the less stress i encounter the stronger my body will be to fight this cancer.

I know times are tough and a lot of you have already helped me. But this is my life and I need to fight this. Im asking you whatever you can do, even a dollar or shekel will help. Can you skip that night out once? Can you watch a movie at home instead  of going to the theater? I know its a lot to ask but again this is my life I'm fighting for, not a economic or comfort plea!!

As to what you will get by helping me the best I can offer you today is the knowledge that you helped my kids  have their mother around as they grow up and get married. I wish I had more to give but all my resources both financially and spiritually are going to one cause and one cause only..to live!!
<div>

Please spread this message either by word of mouth or by Facebook , You Tube, Twitter etc etc...You never know who may be touched by my story. I have encountered many generous strangers who, after hearing my story, felt a connection due to something that happened in their lives. However you can spread my story it would be a big help!
I hope my story will inspire other people to do the same , Miracles happen..we just need to believe!!

What We Need & What You Get

Any money raised will go to helping me survive longer. There are stories of people who have tried these alternative ways and have lived decades longer than what they were told. I need to buy all organic foods, I need to pay the bio chemist who is monitoring my blood levels, i need to fly to see the Chinese doctor who is advising me on what herbal medicines I should be taking. column2: >Gabriel is 5. His best friend is a teddy bear named Buddy. He enjoys playing with friends, art, music, geology, bow ties, astrology books, trips to the Museum, hiking and robots. He is also very passionate about the charity he runs called Buddy's Foundation which helps those in need. (find him here https://www.facebook.com/BuddysFoundation?ref=hl) .

>
Gabriel has seizures which restrict him from being a child. He can not swim, take a bath, climb on playground equipment or ride a bicycle. These episodes cause uncertainty in his daily routine as they are unpredictable. He may start his morning thinking he is going to school, only to spend a few days at  The Childrens hospital. His mother sleeps on the floor next to his bed to be near by because there are times when Gabriel stops breathing, and there have been times when he has awoke and had an episode.

Gabriel has been home schooled since he was 1 year old and enjoyed using large words and playing scrabble (the best he could), now he has regressed and has a very hard time even writing his own name on paper. There have been many medical tests (MRI, EKG, EEG, blood tests and heart monitors) to find a diagnosis with no results. There will continue to be more testing until the family finds a diagnosis and cure to his condition.

Due to medical expenses for his condition his family can not cover their daily expenses such as housing and utilities. Gabriel is in need of several medical devices for home care that his family can not afford.

If you are in a position to help Gabriel in the purchase of his home care items please do so. He is an outstanding little man with much to offer the world, and he has just begun. Please help him continue on his path in life. By helping Gabriel, you are helping others in need as well because the healthier he becomes, the more charity work his foundation can accomplish in the future.
>Anything will help. Even if you are not in a position to help monetarily, the family asks that individuals might share this page with others to spread the word.

>
Thank you from Gabriel, Buddy, and his family!

column5:
>

Fit-Rocker TM  

A great fitness device to fit into everyone's life.

column1: does Fit-Rocker TM work?

column9: > has a rectangular standing platform with a

column1: vertical rocking pole with hydraulic resistance built-in. By standing on the
platform and holding onto the pole with both hands, the push/pull movement
creates a whole body workout that will bring you the great experience of fitness
exercise and will ultimately restore you to good health. Resistance is easily adjusted
on the hydraulic cylinder
column2: simply use the number that matches the desired level

column1: of exertion.
column2: >There are many potential exercise moves to go with Fit-Rocker. Here

column1: are some we’ve developed to get you started:
Easy Rock:
Place your feet as wide as your
shoulders on the step board, with a little bend on both knees, both hands
naturally hold on the rocking handle close to the center of your chest, relax
the whole body from toes to fingers, then use your legs to push your whole body
in left and right rocking cycles for a couple of minutes. This move is recommended
for an easy beginning warm-up and a cool down relaxation before the end of
exercise.
Left Yaolu (a Chinese Rowing Scull):
With both hands holding onto the
handle, turn your body toward the left, place your left foot on the left front
side of the step board and right foot on the right front side of the step
board. Pull the handle back to your center chest and push the handle forward
using your whole body as if you’re rowing a Chinese Rowing Scull Oar. That is
correct. We got the boat and rowing scull movements into the office, living
room and kitchen. Now you can exercise water sport anywhere and anytime you
like.
Right Yaolu (a Chinese Rowing Scull):
Opposite from the left Yaolu, with
both hands holding on to the handle, turn your whole body right, and place your
right foot on the right front side of the step board and left foot on the left
front side of the step board. Pull the handle backward to your center chest and
push the handle forward with the strength of the whole body as above.
Left Frame Saw:
With both hands hold on the handle,
turn your body halfway left, place your left foot on the left front side of the
step board and right foot on the right front side of the step board. Pull the
handle backward to your right shoulder and push the handle forward with the
strength of your whole body just like you are cutting a log with a frame saw.
Right Frame Saw:
Opposite from the left frame saw,
with both hands hold on the handle, turn your body halfway right, and place
your right foot on the right front side of the step board and left foot on the
left front side of the step board. Pull the handle backward to your left
shoulder and push the handle forward with the strength of your whole body as
above.
Whole body kayaking:
Place your feet as wide as your
shoulders (or a little wider) on the step
board, bend both knees as low as you like. With both hands holding on the
rocking handle, start from your legs to push your whole body in left and right
rocking cycles, following the legs pushing through trunk, core muscles, and
shoulder sequence, hands pulling and pushing the handle bar from one side all the
way to the other side. Repeat the action to other side. The balance action
allows the muscles to either push or pull at a relative tension and active relax
cycle. The balance action allows you to work harder without feeling
much soreness in your muscle groups.
Stir the Soup:
Similar to 6, Whole body kayaking. The only
difference is an additional forward or backward movement to push hands around
the center rocking bar like stirring soup on the top of a hot pot with a
clockwise or counter-clockwise movement.
<h3><b style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
design features
device, full actions for whole body:
Fit-Rocker TM is designed
to do many of the functions and movements from activities and chores of “old
time”. The simple back-forth and left-right rocking actions harness all muscle
mobility with Mother Nature’s gravity to improve balance and whole body
strength. Fit-Rocker <sup>TM</sup> is designed to allow one single back-forth
and left-right rotate action to exercise the entire body, especially focusing
on the core muscles and shoulders and back muscle groups. And by focusing on
certain move direction and dynamics, you can customize your workout and target
specific muscle groups. It is one device that provides a whole body workout.
Easy
access:
Since it is one device that provides
for a whole body exercise, a complete workout is now very easy to achieve. Fit-Rocker
<sup>TM</sup> is designed for a very small footprint compare to other devices
currently on the market. There are two footprints at this point:
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
floor standing size is 32”L x 26”D x 48” to 60”H. This small footprint allows Fit-Rocker
TM
column3: > to be setup on any open space.

column1: <li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
fold up size is 32”L x only 7”D x 48” to 60”H. It is easy to store in any space
and easy to carry around.
The small footprint allows Fit-Rocker
<sup>TM</sup> to fit in any place to make whole body exercise readily available
anywhere, anytime you choose.
Unlike other full body workout device
currently on the market, Fit-Rocker <sup>TM</sup> is an all-in-one exerciser
with no additional accessories needed allowing easy setup and adjustment. And
the simplicity is the beauty of the design that makes Fit-Rocker <sup>TM</sup>
the most affordable whole body fitness device available.
Safety:
Fit-Rocker TM is safe and
easy to use. You can operate it anywhere without worry of hurting yourself or others.
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
ground level step board provides easy-on, easy-off movements.
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
resistance power comes from your movement. You move fast and furious, the
device will respond hard and strong. You move slow and mild, the resistance
from the device will be mild and gentle as well. This means that you can
exercise as comfortably or as hard as you want without worry of getting hurt
from the exercise.
<li>
<span style=""line-height: 1.45em
the low gravity design of the device and the additional safeguard extension, the
device is grounded very stably on the floor. It is the most stable fitness
device on the market place.
Trouble
free and maintenance free:
The simplicity of the design and durability
of the components make Fit-Rocker <sup>TM</sup> trouble free and maintenance
free.
What are
I’ve had a variety of different
groups of people try the Fit-Rocker <sup>TM</sup>. Here are their experiences
and opinions.
I hurt my right shoulder not long
ago. After all medicines and therapies, I was advised to stretch and exercise
as a rehabilitation program. I tried and found this Fit-Rocker<sup>TM</sup> is
the perfect device for me to exercise and strengthen my shoulder back to a full
recovery.
S.
It is definitely a very good device
to exercise your core, back, shoulders and all other muscle groups. I also
found this machine to be very useful and effective to strengthen your boxing
power, endurance and improve your explosive force.
Coach
Ike (USPTR Tennis Coach)
I found this device is well-suited to
exercise your core and all other muscle groups that you need to increase your
swing power and improve your game. I think it is a very useful tool to exercise
for tennis, golf, baseball and other sports.
column7: >It all started from my own back pain

column1: I had always been quite fit, maintained an active lifestyle and was
always very healthy. Over the years, with increasing work and family demands, I
no longer had time available to attend to my fitness needs. About 5 years ago I
started to experience chronic back and shoulder pain. I was running around to
doctors getting opinions and testing. Taking painkillers provided little
relief. After becoming frustrated with taking all the painkillers without any
permanent relief, I decided to take a more pro-active approach to my physical
health. I remembered my early days, when I lived in a small fishing village. We
used simple frame saws for cutting lumber, old blast furnace sharpening chisel
for stone works, and a large, heavy sculling oar to drive a “sanban” on the ocean
water. The whole body pumping, rocking motions and hard work of those early
days made me strong, fit and healthy. I began to focus on building the type of
machine that could duplicate those muscle building and strengthening movements.
After much thought and a few drawings, I bought and made up all components, and assembled
my first rocking fitness device. I started to stretch and
gently rock my body on the device every day, increasing the resistance and
range of motion as time progressed. The physical benefits from these natural
motions were truly astounding
column2: I was a new man within a few weeks. My back and

column1: shoulder pain were gone! Additionally, I felt my entire muscular-skeletal
system improving through this simple core strengthening exercise.
Fit-Rocker TM works for me. It’ll

help you too!”

Why Indiegogo?
column4:
>

Fit-Rocker TM is developed to fit into people's everyday life to help them become more fit and healthy. We create this campaign to share this amazing fitness experience, and promote this wonderful product to everyone. It is important to get your involved and support to get Fit-Rocker tm into the rehabilitation and fitness world.  Please support us, and spread the words around, and tell people what Fit-Rocker TM will do to help them achieve a better and healthier life.

column1: We are raising money, a goal of $30,000, to provide additional funds for due legal processes, marketing and sales, engineering and manufacturing etc. with the estimated goal of making Fit-Rocker TM available by the end of September 2014.
Project Execution Time Line
Fit-Rocker is a team of professionals with different background. The vision of Fit-Rocker team is to help people
rehabilitate and improve their health, and to change people’s life to a better
world by providing <span>an easy access whole body
workout device, and a more people, and environmentally-friendly
solution to their health and fitness problem. We try to empower people with a
better, easy access and affordable device that will start to reshape their life
to a better world.
Jay Lin, the founder and CEO of Fit-Rocker, a

veteran product design engineer and manufacturing engineer of laboratory equipment solutions for global brands such as Jewett, Revco, Kendro, and more.

Xinhao Wang, Campaign

Manager, multi-year experience in  project management and digital marketing

","Fit-Rocker TM  A great fitness device to fit into everyone's life.How
does Fit-Rocker TM work?
Fit-Rocker TM has a rectangular standing platform with a
vertical rocking pole with hydraulic resistance built-in. By standing on the
platform and holding onto the pole with both hands, the push/pull movement
creates a whole body workout that will bring you the great experience of fitness
exercise and will ultimately restore you to good health. Resistance is easily adjusted
on the hydraulic cylinder
column2: simply use the number that matches the desired level

column1: of exertion. There are many potential exercise moves to go with Fit-Rocker. Here
are some we’ve developed to get you started:
Easy Rock:
Place your feet as wide as your
shoulders on the step board, with a little bend on both knees, both hands
naturally hold on the rocking handle close to the center of your chest, relax
the whole body from toes to fingers, then use your legs to push your whole body
in left and right rocking cycles for a couple of minutes. This move is recommended
for an easy beginning warm-up and a cool down relaxation before the end of
exercise.
Left Yaolu (a Chinese Rowing Scull):
With both hands holding onto the
handle, turn your body toward the left, place your left foot on the left front
side of the step board and right foot on the right front side of the step
board. Pull the handle back to your center chest and push the handle forward
using your whole body as if you’re rowing a Chinese Rowing Scull Oar. That is
correct. We got the boat and rowing scull movements into the office, living
room and kitchen. Now you can exercise water sport anywhere and anytime you
like.
Right Yaolu (a Chinese Rowing Scull):
Opposite from the left Yaolu, with
both hands holding on to the handle, turn your whole body right, and place your
right foot on the right front side of the step board and left foot on the left
front side of the step board. Pull the handle backward to your center chest and
push the handle forward with the strength of the whole body as above.
Left Frame Saw:
With both hands hold on the handle,
turn your body halfway left, place your left foot on the left front side of the
step board and right foot on the right front side of the step board. Pull the
handle backward to your right shoulder and push the handle forward with the
strength of your whole body just like you are cutting a log with a frame saw.
Right Frame Saw:
Opposite from the left frame saw,
with both hands hold on the handle, turn your body halfway right, and place
your right foot on the right front side of the step board and left foot on the
left front side of the step board. Pull the handle backward to your left
shoulder and push the handle forward with the strength of your whole body as
above.
Whole body kayaking:
Place your feet as wide as your
shoulders (or a little wider) on the step
board, bend both knees as low as you like. With both hands holding on the
rocking handle, start from your legs to push your whole body in left and right
rocking cycles, following the legs pushing through trunk, core muscles, and
shoulder sequence, hands pulling and pushing the handle bar from one side all the
way to the other side. Repeat the action to other side. The balance action
allows the muscles to either push or pull at a relative tension and active relax
cycle. The balance action allows you to work harder without feeling
much soreness in your muscle groups.
Stir the Soup:
Similar to 6, Whole body kayaking. The only
difference is an additional forward or backward movement to push hands around
the center rocking bar like stirring soup on the top of a hot pot with a
clockwise or counter-clockwise movement.
The
design featuresOne
device, full actions for whole body:
Fit-Rocker TM is designed
to do many of the functions and movements from activities and chores of “old
time”. The simple back-forth and left-right rocking actions harness all muscle
mobility with Mother Nature’s gravity to improve balance and whole body
strength. Fit-Rocker TM is designed to allow one single back-forth
and left-right rotate action to exercise the entire body, especially focusing
on the core muscles and shoulders and back muscle groups. And by focusing on
certain move direction and dynamics, you can customize your workout and target
specific muscle groups. It is one device that provides a whole body workout.
Easy
access:
Since it is one device that provides
for a whole body exercise, a complete workout is now very easy to achieve. Fit-Rocker
TM is designed for a very small footprint compare to other devices
currently on the market. There are two footprints at this point:
The
floor standing size is 32”L x 26”D x 48” to 60”H. This small footprint allows Fit-Rocker
TM to be setup on any open space.
The
fold up size is 32”L x only 7”D x 48” to 60”H. It is easy to store in any space
and easy to carry around.
The small footprint allows Fit-Rocker
TM to fit in any place to make whole body exercise readily available
anywhere, anytime you choose.Affordable:
Unlike other full body workout device
currently on the market, Fit-Rocker TM is an all-in-one exerciser
with no additional accessories needed allowing easy setup and adjustment. And
the simplicity is the beauty of the design that makes Fit-Rocker TM
the most affordable whole body fitness device available.
Safety:
Fit-Rocker TM is safe and
easy to use. You can operate it anywhere without worry of hurting yourself or others.
The
ground level step board provides easy-on, easy-off movements.
The
resistance power comes from your movement. You move fast and furious, the
device will respond hard and strong. You move slow and mild, the resistance
from the device will be mild and gentle as well. This means that you can
exercise as comfortably or as hard as you want without worry of getting hurt
from the exercise.
With
the low gravity design of the device and the additional safeguard extension, the
device is grounded very stably on the floor. It is the most stable fitness
device on the market place.
Trouble
free and maintenance free:
The simplicity of the design and durability
of the components make Fit-Rocker TM trouble free and maintenance
free.
What are people saying?
I’ve had a variety of different
groups of people try the Fit-Rocker TM. Here are their experiences
and opinions. Elizabeth
G.
I hurt my right shoulder not long
ago. After all medicines and therapies, I was advised to stretch and exercise
as a rehabilitation program. I tried and found this Fit-RockerTM is
the perfect device for me to exercise and strengthen my shoulder back to a full
recovery.
Sean
S. (Shotokan Practitioner)
It is definitely a very good device
to exercise your core, back, shoulders and all other muscle groups. I also
found this machine to be very useful and effective to strengthen your boxing
power, endurance and improve your explosive force.
Coach
Ike (USPTR Tennis Coach)
I found this device is well-suited to
exercise your core and all other muscle groups that you need to increase your
swing power and improve your game. I think it is a very useful tool to exercise
for tennis, golf, baseball and other sports.Where did this come from?It all started from my own back pain
I had always been quite fit, maintained an active lifestyle and was
always very healthy. Over the years, with increasing work and family demands, I
no longer had time available to attend to my fitness needs. About 5 years ago I
started to experience chronic back and shoulder pain. I was running around to
doctors getting opinions and testing. Taking painkillers provided little
relief. After becoming frustrated with taking all the painkillers without any
permanent relief, I decided to take a more pro-active approach to my physical
health. I remembered my early days, when I lived in a small fishing village. We
used simple frame saws for cutting lumber, old blast furnace sharpening chisel
for stone works, and a large, heavy sculling oar to drive a “sanban” on the ocean
water. The whole body pumping, rocking motions and hard work of those early
days made me strong, fit and healthy. I began to focus on building the type of
machine that could duplicate those muscle building and strengthening movements.
After much thought and a few drawings, I bought and made up all components, and assembled
my first rocking fitness device. I started to stretch and
gently rock my body on the device every day, increasing the resistance and
range of motion as time progressed. The physical benefits from these natural
motions were truly astounding
column2: I was a new man within a few weeks. My back and

column1: shoulder pain were gone! Additionally, I felt my entire muscular-skeletal
system improving through this simple core strengthening exercise.
Fit-Rocker TM works for me. It’ll

help you too!”Why Indiegogo?Fit-Rocker TM is developed to fit into people's everyday life to help them become more fit and healthy. We create this campaign to share this amazing fitness experience, and promote this wonderful product to everyone. It is important to get your involved and support to get Fit-Rocker tm into the rehabilitation and fitness world.  Please support us, and spread the words around, and tell people what Fit-Rocker TM will do to help them achieve a better and healthier life.

We are raising money, a goal of $30,000, to provide additional funds for due legal processes, marketing and sales, engineering and manufacturing etc. with the estimated goal of making Fit-Rocker TM available by the end of September 2014. Thank you for your support!!

INSTEAD OF LINGERIE, SEX AND STRANGERS
IT WILL BE ENGLISH LESSONS, ACADEMICS AND FRIENDS.

column2: >

column1: <h2 style=""margin-left: 30px

Be a founding partner of this awesome project to brighten up the world of kids in a Bangkok Red Light District! Make this project Your Story, too! Any size donation you make from your heart will help these kids. This first campaign will raise money for formation of the legal Thai entity and the first year of operation.

You will truly be able to say that you helped start-up the Happy Faces Bangkok Night Care and Learning Center, a safe place for the little eye witnesses who are currently totally vulnerable to the sights and sounds of the red light environment.  We will be posting occasional updates as we go through this fundraising process so you can keep your friends up to date on how “your” project is going!

We think you’re an awesome bunch of people and we thank you for your action in helping us accomplish this, and demonstrating that there are people in this world who care about protecting kids and saying ""No"" to sex trafficking.
<h2 style=""margin-left: 30px
Rescuing kids from the sights and sounds of the sex trade. Helping them build their own vision of a future in a traffic free environment!
There is NOTHING inside the red light district to care for these kids.

When you walk down the streets of the red light district and see what goes on, it is inconceivable that little children from the ages of around 3-10 years old are wandering around inside the bars and in the market/vendor areas, some hidden under tables when sleeping.

Within this “community” there is an underlying population of innocent eyewitnesses to everything that occurs in the area, and they are the children of those who drive, provide and enhance the area for the sex trafficking business. Not only is there no escape from watching and listening, but in many cases the children are required to work selling items such as roses inside the bars where  business is taking place, or sit at their mother’s  sexy lingerie display as men come by to purchase something for the girl they just bought for the night. They witness women, girls and boys being fondled by strangers, moms getting naked, women getting slapped and beaten, and thousands of men a year coming here to do it. Sometimes, they see their own authorities (police, offcials, etc.) participating in these activates as both sellers and buyers.

In a society where “nice” Thai women do not enter these areas, there is an additional stigma attached to the children of those who support the sex industry here, especially girls. They are victims of their circumstances and have no choice but to be steeped in the midst of it. We want to change that.

That is why Happy Faces Bangkok Night Care and Learning Center will be located in the middle of the red light district, creating an environment where more healthy physical and psychological development can take place.  Good food, a place to learn (including English), study, do homework, and sleep. Thai Supervising Staff.

The normal development of these children is certainly affected. The environment a child grows up in is critical in the child’s development and well-being, and these kids live in a very challenging environment on many levels.  These kids are at increased risk for sexual abuse and being taken into the sex trade as they grow older. They are positioned to become supporters of the sex industry themselves, whether by being trafficked for sex, working for supportive business, etc.
What a different picture we wish to paint!  We plan to help change the course of this upcoming generation of kids in the red light district of Patpong. We plan to bring Love and Hope in big measure!
In addition, through regular interaction and relationship with mothers we can help those actively being trafficked to connect with appropriate NGO's that can rescue and restore them.
<h2 style=""margin-left: 30px

You can make a difference and invest in this project!  The funds we are raising with this campaign are for the purpose of start-up: We first need to pay for set up of  necessary legal documents to conduct this program in Thailand. The Thai government requires strict application process for those working with children.

Then we'll be outfitting the property with appropriate furniture, fixtures and teaching materials. We'll be leasing space from an organization that's been in the red light district for over 21 years helping trafficked women.
Awesome things have happened so far! We have agreement on the commercial property we've chosen, right in the middle of this district! Join in on the opportunity to provide this Center!
All contributions from the USA are tax deductible through Waiting at the Well.
Contact us via email: happyfacesbangkok@gmail.com
","* All photo credits to Connie Rock and Kristen Torres-Toro
** Check out the video in the Gallery, too!

Short Summary
Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:
<ul>
• My Name is Edward Dobson
• My Grandmother passed away from Leukemia and my Uncle from Pancreatic Cancer
• Health Canada is phasing out Personal Production Licenses and will make Cannabis Medicine Unaffordable for most of the 20,000 Medical Cannabis Patients in Canada.
• They are doing this by making regulations that only Licensed secure facilities will be able to produce medical Cannabis.

• I HAVE to get a facility up and running to produce Cheap, Legal, Quality, Medical grade Cannabis that is Quality inspected, meets all security requirements, and are the strains suitable for patients.
• Most of all, WITHIN A PRICE THAT PEOPLE CAN AFFORD.
• By helping me, you help All Medical Cannabis Patients.
• They CANNOT be ALLOWED to suffer at the hands of the government ANYMORE!
• Your contributions will help ensure their safety!
What We Need &
Break it down for folks in more detail:
<ul>
• I am looking to raise $100,000 to start this amazing project.
• Land, Building, Security and staff are all components of this project that have to be achieved.
• Perks I am offering are Positions on the top Contributors Plaque to be prominently displayed in the entrance to our Facility.
• If I do not reach my entire Goal, the money will be used to start the facility.
The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:
<ul>
• Your contribution, down the road, can make the difference to a sick Canadian, possibly a relative.
• Most Canadians that grow their own medicine do so for less than $0.50 per gram.
• Health Canada wants to let big business and Pharmaceutical Companies take this over and sell to the patient for $8.00-$10.00 per GRAM!!
• This is unconscionable!!
• Most patients are on Fixed incomes and simply cannot afford this!
• We CANNOT let them Die due to Government incompetence!
• Would you not want your family member to have the highest quality, lowest priced medication they can that helps them?
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>
• Even if you can’t contribute that’s ok.
• Please help by sharing my Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, social media of all sorts, whatever you can do to help will be amazing!
• Please go to Indiegogo and use their share tools to spread the word for this important campaign.

Did you know there are more than 500 people diagnosed with Breast Cancer in the US each day?
In the UK, it’s more than 120 per day, and in Australia, there’s more than 36 people diagnosed with breast cancer each and every day.
And something like 30% of all cancers diagnosed in women are breast cancers.
~~~~~~~~
October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, and we Need Your Help Now please!
~~~~~~~~
Our Mission:

We all know someone who has been affected by Breast Cancer, and whilst a lot of great work is being done around the world on prevention and research to find a cure, our Breast Cancer Bags Appeal is to help out those who are affected now, and until such time as we can cure this terrible disease.

The number of people undergoing breast cancer surgeries is staggering, and we need your help to expand our Breast Cancer Bags Appeal and help brighten the day of a Mother, Sister, Aunt or friend who’s in need of a little pick-me-up.
Our Appeal:

My Mum and I have an Australian-based online business designing and selling patterns for quilts and bags, and a couple of years ago one of our Bag Club members contacted me, looking for a pattern for a suitable bag for breast cancer surgery patients.

Mastectomy or breast cancer surgery usually requires one or more drains, which empty into a 500ml/pint size bottle or pouch that the patient has to carry around with them.  Usually they are sent home with these drains and bottles in place, and they can remain there for a matter of weeks or even a month or so.
Until that point, I had no idea that such a thing was required, and assumed that if anything like that was needed, that the hospital would just supply it anyway.

Imagine my horror, when I found out that in this day and age, often these women are sent home with their bottles in a pillowcase, or worse – a plastic disposable shopping bag.  If it’s not bad enough to suffer the trauma of breast surgery, the indignity of then having to carry around your surgical ‘bits and pieces’ must be truly awful.
“Dear Bag Makers,

I would like to thank you for doing this, I was one of those ladies that brought home a pillow case with my drains. I was so self-conscious of it ,I didn't go out until they were taken out and as I am only 38 !! it does nothing to help the process along to try to recover. So once again THANKYOU to you and everybody that will do this. You make me feel like people care .
Kind Regards,  Perry”
“Jody &
column2: Annette, I was interested to receive this email from you in regard to helping BC patients with a bag to accommodate their drain bags.  I, myself are familiar with this predicament, as I have had a double mastectomy only 4 years ago.  It’s a great idea and I had a super friend who made something similar for me, which later I used as a peg bag, but at the time it was priceless.  I want to thank you on behalf of all the ladies you are trying to help.

column1: Regards,  Charmane.”
And so we started our Breast Cancer Bags Appeal.
Over the past couple of years, wonderful sewing volunteers around the world have made our one-size-fits-all bags, and donated them to their local hospitals, for their breast cancer surgery patients.
We are not a registered charity - we are just regular people who were inspired by a need, and decided to try and do our bit to make a difference.

We have sent out in excess of 2200 bags ourselves in Australia, through donations sent to us directly. This is still an ongoing commitment, but we would love to expand it now so that even more patients can benefit from this small, but meaningful assistance.
“Words alone cannot express our thanks to you and your band of volunteers who have provided us with such a fantastic array of drain bags for our ladies.
…They will be a beautiful gift at a difficult time.
I am sure they will be treasured by those who use them.”
- Jane, Breast Care Nurse, Sydney
“Hi Jody,
I simply want to take the opportunity to thank you (and those involved) for your generosity in providing our service with the collection of lovely drainage bag bottles I received in the mail today.
They are truly fantastic and really lovely!!!  It is small things such as this that assist in making a woman's breast cancer experience more tolerable and personalised.
Please pass on my thanks to all of the women involved in this project on behalf of my patients!!!  I know they will appreciate them”.
Warm Regards,  Rebecca, Breast Care Nurse, Warrnambool
Our Goal:

Our dream is that no-one will have to go home with a hospital pillowcase or plastic bag for their drains following breast cancer surgery.  We would love to expand our Appeal, so that local Community , High School and Sewing Groups could look after the bag needs of their local hospitals, around the world.
As a 2-person team now, we can only reach so far, and in order to achieve our goal, we need to set up a bigger awareness and marketing campaign, with a website and info packs that can be sent out.

With the money raised through this Indiegogo Appeal, we will set up a website where individuals and groups can register their offer to make bags, and where hospitals can register their needs for bags.  We will have downloadable information packs available with the bag pattern, so that with your help, we can start the ball rolling on getting more bags to more needy people.

A basic website to do this will be around $5000, and the remainder of funds raised will go towards production and distribution of the info packs.  This is still really just Phase 1 – this will be enough to get our expansion started properly, but any additional funds will make a huge difference to the interactive side and scope of the website, and just how far we can set up this program around the world.

Already, we have had support from as far afield as Hawaii, Texas and Costa Rica, and we know of a few groups internationally that have embraced this appeal and are now supporting their local hospitals’ needs.
How You Can Help:
We would really appreciate your support.  Please donate what you can – even a dollar will help us show some love and support to a breast cancer surgery patient.

Please spread the Word about our campaign to your friends – the more people that hear about this through Facebook, Twitter, Blogs or Forums the better, as this campaign is also about awareness and we are truly grateful for your support.
If you sew - please request a copy of our Breast Cancer Bag Pattern in the box at the RHS on www.Quilts-n-Bags.com

The number of people undergoing breast cancer surgeries is staggering, and we need your help to expand our Breast Cancer Bags Appeal and help brighten the day of a Mother, Sister, Aunt or friend who’s in need of a little pick-me-up.
Our Appeal:

My Mum and I have an Australian-based online business designing and selling patterns for quilts and bags, and a couple of years ago one of our Bag Club members contacted me, looking for a pattern for a suitable bag for breast cancer surgery patients.

Mastectomy or breast cancer surgery usually requires one or more drains, which empty into a 500ml/pint size bottle or pouch that the patient has to carry around with them.  Usually they are sent home with these drains and bottles in place, and they can remain there for a matter of weeks or even a month or so.
Until that point, I had no idea that such a thing was required, and assumed that if anything like that was needed, that the hospital would just supply it anyway.

Imagine my horror, when I found out that in this day and age, often these women are sent home with their bottles in a pillowcase, or worse – a plastic disposable shopping bag.  If it’s not bad enough to suffer the trauma of breast surgery, the indignity of then having to carry around your surgical ‘bits and pieces’ must be truly awful.
“Dear Bag Makers,

I would like to thank you for doing this, I was one of those ladies that brought home a pillow case with my drains. I was so self-conscious of it ,I didn't go out until they were taken out and as I am only 38 !! it does nothing to help the process along to try to recover. So once again THANKYOU to you and everybody that will do this. You make me feel like people care .
Kind Regards,  Perry”

“Jody & Annette, I was interested to receive this email from you in regard to helping BC patients with a bag to accommodate their drain bags.  I, myself are familiar with this predicament, as I have had a double mastectomy only 4 years ago.  It’s a great idea and I had a super friend who made something similar for me, which later I used as a peg bag, but at the time it was priceless.  I want to thank you on behalf of all the ladies you are trying to help.
Regards,  Charmane.”
And so we started our Breast Cancer Bags Appeal.
Over the past couple of years, wonderful sewing volunteers around the world have made our one-size-fits-all bags, and donated them to their local hospitals, for their breast cancer surgery patients.
We are not a registered charity - we are just regular people who were inspired by a need, and decided to try and do our bit to make a difference.

We have sent out in excess of 2200 bags ourselves in Australia, through donations sent to us directly. This is still an ongoing commitment, but we would love to expand it now so that even more patients can benefit from this small, but meaningful assistance.
“Words alone cannot express our thanks to you and your band of volunteers who have provided us with such a fantastic array of drain bags for our ladies.
…They will be a beautiful gift at a difficult time.
I am sure they will be treasured by those who use them.”
- Jane, Breast Care Nurse, Sydney
“Hi Jody,
I simply want to take the opportunity to thank you (and those involved) for your generosity in providing our service with the collection of lovely drainage bag bottles I received in the mail today.
They are truly fantastic and really lovely!!!  It is small things such as this that assist in making a woman's breast cancer experience more tolerable and personalised.
Please pass on my thanks to all of the women involved in this project on behalf of my patients!!!  I know they will appreciate them”.
Warm Regards,  Rebecca, Breast Care Nurse, Warrnambool
Our Goal:

Our dream is that no-one will have to go home with a hospital pillowcase or plastic bag for their drains following breast cancer surgery.  We would love to expand our Appeal, so that local Community , High School and Sewing Groups could look after the bag needs of their local hospitals, around the world.
As a 2-person team now, we can only reach so far, and in order to achieve our goal, we need to set up a bigger awareness and marketing campaign, with a website and info packs that can be sent out.

With the money raised through this Indiegogo Appeal, we will set up a website where individuals and groups can register their offer to make bags, and where hospitals can register their needs for bags.  We will have downloadable information packs available with the bag pattern, so that with your help, we can start the ball rolling on getting more bags to more needy people.

A basic website to do this will be around $5000, and the remainder of funds raised will go towards production and distribution of the info packs.  This is still really just Phase 1 – this will be enough to get our expansion started properly, but any additional funds will make a huge difference to the interactive side and scope of the website, and just how far we can set up this program around the world.

Already, we have had support from as far afield as Hawaii, Texas and Costa Rica, and we know of a few groups internationally that have embraced this appeal and are now supporting their local hospitals’ needs.
How You Can Help:
We would really appreciate your support.  Please donate what you can – even a dollar will help us show some love and support to a breast cancer surgery patient.

Please spread the Word about our campaign to your friends – the more people that hear about this through Facebook, Twitter, Blogs or Forums the better, as this campaign is also about awareness and we are truly grateful for your support.
If you sew - please request a copy of our Breast Cancer Bag Pattern in the box at the RHS on www.Quilts-n-Bags.com",1.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Sydney, Australia",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/breast-cancer-bags-appeal/pica

","Backstory: Save a pair of living SF Treasures
WHO: ""The Twins"" - Vivian & Marian Brown.

Legends not only in SF but stars of numerous retail campaigns for companies such as: Virgin Atlantic, Reebok, IBM, and AT&T. You may also have seen the 85 year-old twins during their nightly dinner ritual at Uncle Vitto's Pizza at Bush and Powell.
WHAT: YOUR DONATIONS ARE NEEDED
WHERE: If you donate here, money goes directly to the twins (only).
WHY: http://bit.ly/gatebrowns  http://bit.ly/sfistbrowns

Recently, the sisters have been separated (for the first time in YEARS) due to Vivian Brown's advancing Alzheimers, which hospitalized her, per her doctor's orders. It's expensive for Marian to travel to spend time with her sister -- so she only gets to visit twice a week.  There is also question as to how they'll fund their housing in these later years.
We've enjoyed their presence and contribution to the San Francisco culture & community for many years, here's your chance to lend a hand.
Your contribution will help these ladies live out their future, TOGETHER.
WHEN: Between now & September 15th
Your contributions to this account can help with the costs of helping them spend time together.
If you can't contribute, please share this link:
Please share on just ONE of your social networks or by email to friends or family who may know of the twins and their amazing contribution to San Francisco's energy and community.
Thank You!
Jennie ~ @JennieB! & Peter ~ @russianbear",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

","How You Can Survive The Coming $220.00 Per Barrel Oil Prices? YES, it's coming!

column1: If you don't understand the magnitude of ""peak oil"" and the impact it is now having on the global economy, please watch this YouTube video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=_qeRaBaPRmk.

Did you asked for cheaper alternatives to oil and gas? The H2-Flex is a self-contain hydrogen generator and low-cost fuel-cell that converts water, under any condition, into very clean and pure hydrogen gas on-demand for every type of vehicle on the road (including EV).

The 20-inch H2-Flex produces pure hydrogen at the rate of 60 PSI, which is added to the normal fuel line and fuel mixture. This greatly improves overall combustion quality by allowing higher octane, a faster burn, and very clean burn. You will greatly reduce, or completely eliminate, the amount of gasoline or diesel the engine needs (see FAQ).

About 10 liters of hydrogen gas is stored in the filter system. This type of storage is considered the safest. Even gunshot tests on full hydrogen storage alloy do not result in any combustible reaction, which clearly demonstrates the safety level of the product. Unlike the high-pressure hydrogen cylinders, hydrogen is bonded with the alloy metal chemically. So it will take hours before the system fully release the gas in event of leakage caused by system’s damage.

No electricity is required! H2-Flex MAKES PURE H2 at much higher rates than electrolysis with NO OXYGEN generated.  That means NO need for O2 extenders needed, and no need for EFIE fuel injection system modifications to your car. It works on a simple and very inexpensive chemical reaction using aluminum and water!

This is the ideal situation for your car as there is no questioning if you have enough output or if you could benefit from additional ‘fine tuning’ such as adding O2 extenders to your oxygen sensors or adding an EFIE (Electronic Fuel Injection Enhancer). Chemical Mode allows you to immediately find out how much gains are possible in your specific vehicle with hydrogen.
Connecting the H2-Flex to any vehicle is a relatively simple 3-step, 10-Minute process:
1) Place the H2-Flex in the trunk (or back) of a vehicle
2) Join the hose to the fuel line, which is under the back seat of most vehicles
3) Add water to the container.
User would then be able to go between 100 to 150 miles to the gallon of gas. This is considerably more MPG than most hybrid vehicle on the market!
The Impact

Our mission is to raise funding for tooling and production of the H2-Flex, secure a strong management team, and provide clean, portable, and inexpensive gas to everyone QUICKLY! If there is no H2-Flex, expect to park your vehicle (and the economy) in 2012! Don't expect Governments to solve the current energy crisis, the ultra-powerful oil industry will not allow any changes until every drop of oil is out of the ground!
What We Need & What You will Get

The H2-Flex was designed and engineered by a team of specialists from California, China, and India, using powerful Computer Aided Design (CAD) software. $55,000 is now needed for tooling of the H2-Flex for prototype production, which will be completed in 30 ~ 45 days. Your contribution of US$500 will serve as special ""pre-order"" price and lower contribution will be ""down-payment"". Please note that this is on a first come, first serve basis.

The production process will be outsourced to a well-established manufacturer. This way, we can get the H2-Flex out to you quickly while keeping cost low so even people in the developing world can afford it. If our goal is not met, we will hire a management consulting firm to create a proposal for venture funding. Each step of the process will be made known here and through our website: www.maynex.com.
Other Ways You Can Help

For those who may not know what's about to hit them (i.e., very high oil and gas prices), It would be very nice of you to get the word out to them so they too can be prepared before the storm hits. You can get the word out via Twitter, Facebook, email, or any other means. You can also go to www.maynex.com and click the Facebook ""Like"" button.",4.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Corvington, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/go-300-miles-on-water-to-gas/pica

This October Jenny Deida, Osiris Flores and Shawn Garcia of Revolutionary Fitness will be riding a 600 mile round trip from New York City to Washington D.C with the aim of raising awareness and funds for Donation Based Health Services. There is an obvious void between the ongoing Health crisis-taking place in our underdeveloped/working class communities and the lack of services being provided by state throughout the country. This monster of a ride will help in the continuing effort to support organic grassroots movements within our working class communities who are refusing to fall victim to what the power structure has our communities set up for.

Jenny, Osiris and Shawn are all avid cyclist enthusiast and will be setting out on an intense 8-week training program to prepare physically and mentally for a ride they plan on conquering over 5 days (avg. 120 miles a day). On top of that, they are dedicated fixed gear (locked in single speed) riders, which of course takes this ride across the Mid-Atlantic region to another level. Below is their workout program for the next 8 weeks:

column2:
>Week 7 (Sep 25- Oct 1)
Tuesday 55 miles
Wednesday 55 miles
Thursday 55 miles
Friday 40 miles
Saturday 140 miles

>Week 8 (Oct 2- Oct 8 )
Tuesday 60 miles
Wednesday 60 miles
Thursday 60 miles
Friday 40 miles
Saturday 160 miles

>*Before every ride they will be taking themselves through an intense Eischen Yoga power sequence. And all this is in addition to their regular individual strength training and classes they are conducting on a weekly basis.

column1: There will then be 3 days of rest with healthy plant based eating with Eischen Yoga and the journey will begin on,Wednesday October 12th at 10am.

A lot of support will be needed during these intense weeks of training and anyone who wishes to participate in any or all of the training rides are welcomed. It would also be awesome if you partake in enough of the training and feel ready to take on the ride yourself.

Each rider has a quota of trying to raise $1600.00 dollars over the 8 weeks of training. This will be done through personal contacts, online social networks and reaching out to different individuals and organizations. These funds will be split evenly between
Revolutionary Fitness - Nonprofit Health and Fitness Organization, providing donation based fitness and nutrition services in underdeveloped/working class communities throughout the city of New York.

Healthy Kids in the Heights - A summer program designed to motivate and teach children aged 6-11 to move more, eat better, and quiet their minds. Empowering low-income communities to live healthier lifestyles.

Da Urban Butterflies - The Program strives and is committed to build strong, conscious and pro-active youth leaders (with a focus on young women of color) to work for social justice in the Washington Heights/Inwood (WH/I) community and beyond.
A.N.S.W.E.R. Coalition - A National Coalition fighting to end Imperialist Wars being conducted abroad and fighting for social justice issues around classism and racism domestically.

More information will come out in the next few weeks about fundraising efforts and check in daily to www.RevFitNYC.org to get updates on training and progress for this intense bike ride raising consciousness about Donation Based Health Services in our communities!

Short Summary

My name is Matt Betzold, I go by many titles, such as husband, dad, amputee, cage fighter.  These titles make up the very core of who I am. I lost my leg when I was 6-years-old, due to someone poisoning some candy that they gave to me. I used to street fight often, but got myself on the straight and narrow in high-school by joining an MMA gym. I wanted to fight MMA, and I trained years to do it, but it wasn't that easy.  I fought battle after battle just to get the right to step in the cage because people believed I couldn't handle myself.  I was finally allowed to fight, and became the first amputee to fight in a sanctioned MMA match, and now I hold the World Fighting Federation's Flyweight Title.

Along with MMA, I have actively competed in the grappling world for 10 years, and now hold a grappling record of 150 wins and 29 losses.  I have represented the U.S. Grappling Team twice, taking 2nd in the Worlds.  I now have the opportunity to represent the U.S. MMA Team.  I fought for my position on the team and took it in April of this year.  I need to raise the funds to get myself to Russia to compete in the FILA 2012 Senior World Championships, where I will not only become the first amputee to fight on the U.S. MMA Team, but also the first to bring home the gold.
<div>
<h3>What We Need &amp

I need to raise $2700 to get myself to Russia to compete, and to assist with costs of finishing up my training camp.  I have been putting all of my focus into training for this competition so that I can come home with the gold. I want to, once and for all, break down all preconceived notions of what an amputee is capable of.
I can promise all of the donors that I will train and fight with everything I have, and that they will be an integral part to me reaching this goal.

If any donors wish to make a larger contribution, I could wear company shirts or patches while I'm in Russia competing. Just get in contact with me on my Facebook, so we can work something out.  I am also open to suggestions if they have any other requests.
<div>
The Impact

All of these tournaments and MMA fights I win are not just a victory for me and my family.  I am out to show people that you can always do anything you set your mind to if you want it bad enough and you work hard enough.  I currently work with different people, including our country's servicemen to help them overcome their physical and mental challenges.  I want to help the soldier who came home with a missing limb to know that he can still be just as good in combat as he was before, or the child who gets picked on for being different to own his differences and not hide from them
column2: for everyone in between who doubts themselves to know that we are all only as capable as we allow ourselves to be.

column1: <div>
Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that times are tough right now, and everyone might not be able to donate.  However, it would be extremely appreciated if you could spread the word, and share this with everyone you know.  Thank you for taking the time to read this, I am extremely grateful for any help or contributions.

Short Summary

John and Diana were expecting twins on October 19, 2012.  In the second week of July they took a vacation down to North Carolina to visit family.  Shortly into the stay, Diana's water broke.  She had to get an emergency c-section by doctors she'd never met and in a hospital that was unfamiliar to her.  On July 14, 2012, Isabella Grace was born at 1 pound 14 ounces and Mason John at 2 pounds and 1.8 ounces.  Since the hospital didn't have a NICU, Isabella and Mason had to be brought to another hospital 60 miles away from Diana.  Since the babies weren't fully developed by that time, they were both put on a respirator, amongst other equipment to assist their growth and development outside of their mother's womb.  John and Diana were eventually able to get a room at the Ronald McDonald House, where they have been staying since.  They have been at their babies' sides, day in and day out, wondering if the next minute will bring an advancement or a setback.  John and Diana would love to be able to bring their babies home, where they could be under close watch at the Golisano Children's Hospital in Rochester, NY, and be closer to family, friends, their jobs and their home.
<div>
What We Need

Although they would never ask, this fund is to support John, Diana and their two blessings in getting home, which is $14,000 alone because of the massive amount of equipment and staff needed to support them in their condition during the journey, and to assist with other finances that this critical situation has brought upon them.
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

It is understood that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help :)  Getting the word out and making some noise about this is just as needed!  Please use the tools available to you from this page to do so.  And of course, prayers are ALWAYS welcome!

If you would like to personally send cards etc. to John and Diana, the address where they are staying is listed below:

c/o Ronald McDonald House
419 S. Hawthorne Rd
Winston-Salem, NC 27103
