column1: UPDATE 4/30: We hit the goal!! Yes! But please don't stop contributing and keep sharing this with your friends! $1200 was a low-end estimate for the project, and we can use every penny. All extra funds go right back into the project to get more people involved. Getting 1000 respondents will not be easy, even with 4 months.
Thank you so much! We did it! This great research will happen because of you. Give yourself a good pat on the back and a firm handshake. And a big hug. You deserve it.
My Story

I'm Ted, and I’m a hoop dancer. That means I dance and play with plastic rings for a living, and teach others. Hoop dancing (“hooping”) has enriched my life in so many ways. I hoop for art, for fun, for a creative outlet, for exercise, and for meditation. It’s also my job, and there’s nothing I’d rather be doing!

Before I started hooping I was a certified personal trainer. I helped people get in shape safely. I met lots of people who got hurt because they weren’t educated in how to move and exercise properly, in a way that supports them. I loved helping people gain a better understanding and love of their bodies.As a hoop dance instructor, I meet lots of people getting hurt all around me too. So many hoopers I've met have had pain or injuries, but don't talk about them, or hope they'll magically go away. The truth is that they don’t just go away, and most of them are preventable.
What’s the solution?

In order to keep ourselves safe so we can hoop for many more years, we need to understand our injuries more deeply. What injuries are most common? Why are they happening? When are they happening? Who are they happening to? Only when we fully understand the problem can we create positive, lasting solutions.I am conducting the first large scale, independent study on hooping injuries. The aim of the research is to explore pain and injuries in hoopers, and provide a better understanding of its causes, symptoms, and treatments.
Why should you care?

If you’re a hooper, this is important work. Everything we know about hooping injuries has so far been anecdotal:   “My friend said you don’t need to hoop in both directions”   “My teacher thinks stretching is a waste of time”   “I heard Arnica gel and Reiki are the solutions to Hooper’s Hip”How do we know what to trust? Conflicting opinions are everywhere. Right now it’s one person’s opinion vs. another’s. We don’t have to be in the dark any more. Let’s get closer to the truth!   If you love a hooper, are friends with a hooper, or have ever seen a hooper and want to support this fast growing art form, your contribution can make a real impact.    For a casual hoop dancer - or any dancer, injuries can be painful and demoralizing. For professional hoopers, who depend on their good health to put food on the table, it can be financially devastating. Many hoopers have given up the promise of a stable income to chase their dreams as an artist. Being unable to dance for weeks at a time is simply not an option. Let’s help each other dance forever!
What We Need & What You Get
Our financial goal is $1200. More would be great, but not as critical. This covers:
$300: hosting a professional online survey so we can collect and analyze the data effectively
$600: advertising on Hooping.org to reach the maximum number of hoopers around the world
$100: cash prize randomly awarded to a survey respondent to increase participation, commitment, and awareness of the survey
$200: administrative costs: website fees, fundraising fees, fulfilling fundraiser perks, etc
Here’s the great perks:
$1: A huge thank you and a digital hoop hug
$5: A huge thank you and a digital hoop hug, thank you card, and mention in the newsletter and Facebook group
$10: An email PDF guide: Top 5 Tips for a Perfect Hoop Warmup, and a fancy HIPS pin-back button
$25: Tote bag from Cécile Pompompom of Bristol UK (free shipping to UK/europe, $5 extra shipping to US or Canada)
$25: Your choice of 1 of 4 Hoopnotica instructional hoop DVDs from Tilly Whirls  - SOLD OUT
$50: $30: 1 hour hoop health consultation on Skype
$50: hoop hugger from RainedanceHoops of Ottowa - SOLD OUT
$75: $50: One custom-made taped polypro hoop in your choice of size and colors, generously donated by Serenity Hoops and New Whirled Designs.  SOLD OUT
$100: $75: choice - Skype lesson with Marria & Zach of Ninja Hoops, or Skype consultation with Meagan Ruppert: Building your Business
$325: A Weekend Pass to Hoopfest New England- SOLD OUT
$1000: $500: I will come to your town and host a hoop safety & wellness workshop for you and up to 10 friends.

If we don’t reach our entire goal, we’ll eliminate some advertising and spread the word as best we can, leveraging the power of social media and word of mouth.If we exceed our goal (fingers crossed!), we’ll invest more money into the survey prizes to increase participation and excitement, and possibly advertise on Google, Facebook, and Youtube to reach more people.
The Impact

This informal study is not for personal profit and very much a collaborative effort. I am receiving  input & testing from 2 medical doctors, physical therapist, a clinical research psychologist, 4 certified fitness trainers, a massage therapist, & 2 Pilates instructors. I will be eliciting feedback from the community (that’s YOU!) throughout the process to help guide the project. I want everyone to understand that that it’s for hoopers, by hoopers - and everyone can help in some way. Even if you just tell one friend, or donate a dollar, that's fantastic! Every bit counts.Other Ways You Can Help (and get great exposure for your business)The 3 Most Pressing Needs Right Now:
Help spread the word about this fundraising campaign! Less than 2 days to go!
Free or discounted advertising if you run a high traffic hoop site or blog - now and especially May - August when the survey is live
Other important ways you can participate:

Funny video of you faking a hoop injury. This will be cut into a video with lots of other injuries to promote the survey itself. Be silly. Really ham it up! Charlie Chaplin style. Whack yourself, trip, scream, whatever. You can do a few takes but no more than 15 seconds total.
Share your hoop injury story on video. I'd love to include it in the video I'll be posting during the fundraising drive. Under 1 minute is perfect.
Graphic designer with experience in INFO GRAPHICS
Help spread the word about the survey itself when it goes live May 8 (I can remind you later)

Your help beta-testing the survey & offering feedback in April if you’re a: researcher, doctor, statistician, physical therapist, exercise physiologist, personal fitness trainer, licensed massage therapist, certified Pilates instructor, or other movement expert.

Language translation. The survey is international so we'd like to make it available in other languages. If you have an excellent command of English as well as either Spanish, French or Japanese (I believe those are the most common non-English languages among hoopers), and you can devote some time in May, please let me know.

You don't have to do all these things to help. Just contributing in 1 or 2 ways would be incredible.I will credit you in the survey, promo videos, mailings, and on Facebook for your contributions, so it's great exposure. The study will be advertised on Hoopcity & Hooping.org as well as spread across Facebook and Youtube all summer long, so tens of thousands of hoopers will see your name as a contributor or sponsor.Here are details about the study including how the data will be used & how will the money be used:https://www.facebook.com/groups/hoopstudy/doc/159971170790078/Thank you!Huge thanks to our wonderful sponsors & contributors (so far):Cécile Pompompom - Miss Pompompomhttps://www.facebook.com/MissPompompomJennifer Anderson - RaineDanceHoopshttp://www.rainedancehoops.blogspot.com/Marria & Zach - Ninja Hoopshttps://www.facebook.com/pages/Ninja-Hoops/139616369469094Maria Randolph - HoopFest New Englandhttp://www.hoopfestnewengland.com/Meagan Ruppert - Return to Roots Hoop Gatheringhttp://r2rhoops.comLeslie Perales of Tilly Whirlshttp://tillywhirls.com/Leslie & Dave McKenzie of Serenity Hoops & New Whirled Designshttps://www.facebook.com/pages/Serenity-Hoops-and-New-Whirled-Designs/204957642875652Corie Wallace Designshttp://www.befreckle.comJoin the mailing list for HIPS updates:http://eepurl.com/jZX9DFind us on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/groups/hoopstudy/Email me with questions/comments/suggestions: hoopstudy@gmail.com",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

Introduction

Let's face it, we eat too many bacon cheeseburgers. Heart health is a leading medical issue in developed countries. However, technology development is slow to bring new ideas into the field of pump technology that can be used for cardiac assist and replacement.

We're exporing new pump actions with the intention of advancing health care quality for surgical patients needing cardiac assist equipment. The technology is based on ferrofluid- ferrite nanoparticles suspended in a base liquid. We're raising funds to build prototype pumps. Our prototypes won't be tested on animals. We will design, build, and test the pump in the lab. The backer perks include working pump mechanisms!

Instead of directly appoaching venture capital or approaching medical corporations, we elected to put this project on Indiegogo to try a grass roots approach to launch the exploratory phase of this medical R&
column2: D project. Please get involved by helping us spread the word about this exciting project!

column1: Team
Our team has the background to rapidly complete the technology exploration. Team members include:

-Christopher Suprock, PhD
-Jeffery Nichols, MS ECE
-Joanna Suprock, Project Management
-Biological/Anatomical advisers
Website: www.suprocktech.com
We are located in New Hampshire near Ferrotec Corporation and work with them to source custom ferrofluid and technical advise.
Background

Current pump technology is not optimal for cardiac application because it causes mechanical damage to the blood cells (hemolysis). Centrifugal pump and rotary turbo pump designs are the norm. One example of modern pump technology is the Heartmate II, a turbo pump. These require high dosage of anticoagulant drugs to prevent clotting from occurring due to trauma in the pump unit.  Dangerous conditions may lead to post operative problems such as stroke.

Our goal is to investigate an improved pump technology that minimizes damage to blood tissue and can replace antiquated pump technology to improve the safety of cardiac assist- and eventually- stand alone artificial heart designs.

We're taking a unique approach and exploring the applicability of magnetic fluid technology to mimic muscular behavior. We hope that this research will contribute to replacing the century-old pump technologies still present in modern operating rooms.
Technical Design

There are several technical concepts applicable to this technology. The first is to reproduce traditional chambered designs. Although this is not as suitable for transplant or surgical application, it is a nice way to prove the concept and mimic heart behavior in a test system.
Another way is to build a linear peristaltic pump that could be used for left ventricle assist device (LVAD). This type of assist pump has a larger commercial market versus full replacement pumps.
Many designs are possible- due to the flexibility of the magnetic fluid pump action, designs can range from simple push-pull type to fancy revolving membrane actions.
Perks
Working desktop display of the pumping mechanism:
Ferrofluid, made in New Hampshire, with super magnet (gnu photograph):

Hi!
Thank you for taking out the time to check this page :)

It's been my lifelong dream to run a marathon for a worthy cause. Only a few days ago, I was very fortunate to be selected to run the 2013 Boston Marathon for the the American Liver Foundation (ALF). I'm running my first marathon ever.
So, why am I running for ALF? Here are some facts (all of which those that read the email already know):
<ul>
<li>
2,500 children are diagnosed with liver diseases each year.
• Liver deisease is the 10th leading cause of death in U.S.
• Within the next 20 years hepatitis C (a liver disease) will cause more deaths annually than AIDS in the US.
<li>
4 million Americans are afflicted with hepatitis C today.
So, what does ALF do? They:
<ul>
<li>
Fund research on these diseases (which is helpful on an international scale),
<li>
Provide Advocacy work in terms of advertising &
<li>
Educate the public about preventing such diseases through campaigns
All these functions are important since 70% of folks living with these diseases don't know they have 'em. On a more personal note, my aunt has lived with Hepatitis B for over a decade &
column2: I know firsthand how much she has struggled to live with this liver condition.

column1: I gotta raise $5000 by
column2: >February 15th so any contribution from you is welcome.

column1: I can't do this without your help. Your help will help me raise money for these folks all the while that I train for the biggest physical challenge that I have faced thus far.

I'll periodically update you guys on how my training is going (twitter: @nahgumra) and I am working on having an interactive system in place that can allow you to track my progress on marathon day in real-time (so that you're there right with me!).
Thank you so so much for your support &
Happy Holidays &
Armughan

Within the next 20 years hepatitis C (a liver disease) will cause more deaths annually than AIDS in the US.
4 million Americans are afflicted with hepatitis C today.
So, what does ALF do? They:
Fund research on these diseases (which is helpful on an international scale),
Provide Advocacy work in terms of advertising & campaigning
Educate the public about preventing such diseases through campaigns

All these functions are important since 70% of folks living with these diseases don't know they have 'em. On a more personal note, my aunt has lived with Hepatitis B for over a decade & I know firsthand how much she has struggled to live with this liver condition.
I gotta raise $5000 by February 15th so any contribution from you is welcome.
I can't do this without your help. Your help will help me raise money for these folks all the while that I train for the biggest physical challenge that I have faced thus far.

I'll periodically update you guys on how my training is going (twitter: @nahgumra) and I am working on having an interactive system in place that can allow you to track my progress on marathon day in real-time (so that you're there right with me!).
Thank you so so much for your support & time!
Happy Holidays & I hope 2013 is exciting & amazing for you!
Armughan",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column2: >You may have noticed that our Campaign has ended. Please contact us directly If you are still interested in contributing.

column1: <h2 class=""p1"" style=""text-align: center
<h2 class=""p1"" style=""text-align: center
<h2 class=""p1"" style=""text-align: center
<h2 class=""p1"" style=""text-align: center

Himalayan crystal rock salt is being pioneered by doctors such as Dr Oz as being the purest form of organic salt in the world with amazing healing capabilities. Consisting of 84 different trace elements and life force minerals it contains a bio energetic field and is considered to be a super food by nutritional experts. It is used by allergy and asthma sufferers all over the world. It is my intention to build a salt cave for our community, so that they may have the opportunity to experience these healing benefits.
Salt Caves have been known to alleviate the symptoms of:
<table><tbody><tr>
<td><ul>
• asthma
• chronic bronchitis
• cough
• sinusitis
• ear infection
• psoriasis
<td><ul>
• rhinitis
• hay fever
• respiratory allergies
• cystic fibrosis
• tonsillitis
• eczema
What is a Salt Cave?

A Salt Cave is a chamber where the healing, microclimate of a natural salt cave is reproduced, monitored and controlled inside a room, called a salt cave, by using a special Halotherapy device and technology, called a Prizma"".

During a salt room session the client sits fully dressed in a comfortable chair in our spacious cave like room for 45 minutes (one session), listening to relaxation music and breathing normally. Research has shown that Himalayan salt crystals have a particular kinetic energy emitting natural occurring negative ions that are proven to reduce stress and fatigue while supporting a better sense of well being. By breathing deeply, clients inhale a very light salt infused air very similar to sea air which works on clearing the respiratory system.
Dear friends,

For the last three years I have been relieving the aches and pains as well as the stress and discomfort of clients of all ages and from all walks of life, and during this time I have been a part of so many heartwarming and gratifying experiences that I intend to continue our adventure and journey together by bringing you more experiences that will truly enhance your sense of well being and allow you to really enjoy the art of relaxation.

My business started out as a small sole proprietorship from a one room office in the heart of Bethesda MD on West Lane, and over the last handful of years, I have had the honor of supporting you in a lot of your bodywork endeavors and as always I remain committed to providing you with the best bodywork practices possible. This encompasses both stretching, massage, energy work or anything else that I can do to help you. I have become increasingly aware of your ever rising stress levels and your struggle with allergies wether they be from allergens around you or what you are consuming.

As a bodyworker I am not immune to stress and allergies, and when I first came to America from South Africa, I too fell prey to all the effects that working too hard to build my practice could bring on me. So when I had my first salt cave experience in Asheville NC it was nothing short of life changing. Needless to say I came back to DC filled with a renewed sense of urgency to recreate this amazing experience for your benefit.

Salt caves are known all over the world for having an amazingly soothing effect on people of all ages, and are acclaimed for relieving the symptoms of things such as allergies, stress, sinusitis, barometric headaches, asthma, eczema as well as psoriasis and that is only the tip of the list. It is a chamber built entirely out of tons of Hiamalayan crystal rock salt.

column3: >The room will be approximately 500 sqf in size which is large enough for small intimate groups of 15 people for meditation and yoga purposes and large enough for 20 people to sit fully clothed in the zero gravity reclining chairs which we will be using for our peace and quiet sessions. Not everyone likes music and movement some people just want to be able to breath deeply and sleep. The floors will be covered with salt granules 2-3mm in size and the walls will be built out with bricks and boulders of salt rock ranging from 1 pound to 22 pounds in size. The room will be lit with salt lamps and the ceiling will be covered with salt crystals and lighting as well. The air will be infused with a minute trace of salt which clients inhale and it is here that the healing starts. The colors in the room range from a soft pink to burnt orange, coral and deep reds and with the lighting behind the walls it all melds into a very soothing visual experience.

column1: Some interesting facts about Himalayan crystal rock salt:

column2: >The crystal salt is formed over a period of 250 million years during which micro-organisms are compressed and fossilized into a layer of salt very deep beneath the earths crust. The result is a crystalization process which combines the salt and micro-organisms. How does this help us? The crystal salt is enriched with 84 minerals and trace elements found on the periodic table which is no longer freely available in our every day food. Salt is not on the periodic table but the nutrients in the Himalayan salt crystal are, and it is acclaimed that it is a great source of calcium, magnesium, potassium, zinc and  iron. When dissolved it is alkaline to the skin, and when heated it disperses a negative ionic charge into the air which negates the harmful effects of all the electronics that we surround ourselves with. Crystal salt is a natural anti-microbial agent that is known to kill mould, spores and bacteria. it does not possess added iodide, anti caking agents or preservatives and it is known to be the purest salt on earth, while also being considered of nutritional benefit.

column1: So when a space very close to where I am currently situated became available, I knew that I had to take the leap of faith and take action. I have for quite some time now, wanted to start the process of expanding my business to incorporate elements of natural healing and well being by building the first ever Himalayan rock salt Cave in Bethesda MD. I have always felt that this would be the natural progression in offering new services that would continue our journey together.

I have spoken at great length with many of my clients as to what this would mean for you and how your experience would improve by adding this along with community acupuncture, salt cave yoga and meditation to the list of offerings, and you have all told me, “Build it and we will come”.

So, here we are, I am so excited to say that a once in a life time opportunity presents itself for me. I have found a 2 200 sqf space right next to the Bethesda Metro and the Hyatt Hotel. It is on the ground floor and has the structural integrity that we will need for building a 550 sqf salt chamber. However going from a one room massage studio to a 2 200 sqf  space is going to be a whole different kettle of fish, and to complete this task I need your support.

This has been an incredibly easy but nerve racking decision for me.  I know that building the salt Cave will offer natural healing possibilities beyond our wildest imagination. The most difficult part is actually describing something so beautiful. Its almost impossible if you have not already experienced a salt cave on your own.

I have consulted with salt cave owners and their clients, all eager and willing to share their miracle stories and who have urged me to get started. With their continued support and the support of my clients and community I believe this can really happen and become a reality.
<h3 class=""p1"" style=""margin-left: 30px
column2: >With your support I will be able to do the following:

column1: <ul>
• Redesign the space and make structural changes to the existing building that will allow us to have enough space to fit 16-20 people inside the salt cave at a time.

• Purchase 32 tons of Himalayan rock salt to actually build the internal structure of the salt cave, add a special Halo-generator for infusing the air with Himalayan salt on a micro-ionic level to recreate the sea air, and to build a dedicated HVac system that will ensure the air inside the room remains 10x purer than outside, and also Hermetically sealing the room.

• Expand my services to offer a multitude of differing options which will include but in no way be limited to community acupuncture, salt cave yoga, meditation, aromatherapy workshops, didjeridoo evenings, Tibetan singing bowl events and vibrational energy workshops. The possibilities are endless.

• Stock our store with amazing organic and natural Himalayan rock salt products for use in your home to clean the air, flavor your food, light your childrens rooms, enhance your bathing experience and impress your friends.

The success of this project would mean so much to so many people.  Parents who have travelled as far as Asheville NC, Williamsburg VA and Carlysle PA have all asked if this was something that I think we can accomplish and I truly believe the answer is ""Yes, together we can""
<h3 style=""margin-left: 30px
<h3 style=""margin-left: 30px
column2: >What You Get: also check out the images on our gallery page

column1: <ul>
<li>
The Salt Rock lights :

Salt rocks are fantatstic for cleaning the air of impurities, they are soothing on the eyes, great as night lights and really promote a great nights rest. When the salt is heated it emits a negative ionic charge theat counteracts the harmful effects of electronics that surround us on a day to day basis.Choose from three different sizes starting with the small one which comes in three different styles, is usb powered and great in any kids room, on a bar or just in a little corner as an added ambience., or maybe the medium or large natural boulder shaped lights that come with a globe and dimmer switch, all ready for taking the healing experience home. Change the magnetic vibe inside your home within an instant.
<ul>
<li>
Massages: $85

Choose a lovely combo of maybe a massage with a salt chamber experience afterwards, please remember that the services are only available once we open our doors. If we are delayed in any way with the build out we will be in a position to obviously still do the massage services from our existing location and you would then just have to do the chamber experience on its own once we do open. However we are quite confident that this will not be necessary.
<ul>
<li>
Tequila glasses $18 for 2

2 Tequila glasses.Enjoy a shot of tequila or vodka in style with Shooter glasses made from Himalayan Rock salt, get two, four or six and remember that salt is a natural anti-microbial agent and a quick rinse and air dry cleans the glass to ensure that you have many uses out of it. Maybe you would like to get two with a nifty usb light that changes colors for that intimate setting, and wether its a dorm room or a wet bar in your office its just so unusual you will be sure to be the centre of attention.
<ul>
<li>
Grilling Blocks

Want a salt block to use as a cutting board for preparing veggies, your steak or presenting an amazaing sushi platter? Culinary chefs use blocks of Himalayan salt to age their steaks, present their sushi dishes or just as elegant and unusual centre pieces. we have it in three different sizes for your ease of use or maybe you would like all three. Remember that when the salt block has become smaller due to a lot of use, you can still use the salt to flavor your food by grating it or crushing it depending on how you like it.

Salt tiles, bricks and blocks come in various shapes and sizes. The grilling blocks we are offering is a package of two sizes together. One 8x4x1 size, ideal for preparing sushi or presenting a small cheese platter, plus a 10x6x1 ideal for grilling a steak or chicken on the barbecue. Should we reach our goal, then we would be able to offer different shapes and sizes on a roll out basis.
<ul>
<li>
Himalayan Salt:

Grinder salt or chunks ? Maybe you want some salt to refill your grinder, make a great hand/body scrub or even to use it in your bath after a really hard day at work or workout. We have it in chunks, grinder size as well as powdered salt. Remember, Himalayan Crystal Salt has 84 different minerals and elements in it that no other salt has. Ordinary Sodium Chloride is bleached and devoid of any nutritional benefit. So by using Himalayand Crystal Salt you are actually feeding your body nutrients it needs, and it is in fact a good source of calcium, potassium, magnesium and zinc.
<ul>
<li>
Get $20 for the price of $10 or $50 for the price of $25, either way, you can buy or gift goodies to your hearts content and all in time for the holiday and festive season.

Not interested in being paid in salt like the Roman Soldiers were, well we have some great Salt Chamber sessions or massage series that may suit you better and I am so looking forward to sharing this experience with you.
What happens if we do not reach our goal:

One of the reasons why we have agreed to flexible spending is that the Indiegogo site allows you our clients to pay with a credit card as well as Paypal. If we had decided on the fixed amount you would only get the opportunity to pay with paypal and I know that this would be very limiting for many of my clients.

I have a certain portion of the funds required to start the project and if for some reason I am not able to raise all the funds we need to start the space, we will have to build a smaller chamber. In the event that the salt cave is not built at all, we will still be in a position to meet all massage and salt product obligations and all other funds for salt cave sessions will be returned to the respective contributors. I promise full transparency to all contributors and you will always be kept up to date with where we are in every stage of the project.
Delays:

Should we be delayed for whatever reason, we will keep our clients posted and updated at all times, not only with the progress of our build out but also if things go wrong. All salt products will be available for pick up from October 1st, 2013, all massages can still be done at our current venue, and so construction and buildout delays will only affect salt cave sessions.
The Impact

Research has proven that a salt cave is a safe and alternative manner in which people of all ages can alleviate stress and a general lack of energy. I believe that because of the high pollen counts within the DC metro area, that the salt cave is going to be a valuable asset to children and parents alike and it is my sincere wish that it will decrease the amount of hospital visits for everyone as a result of seasonal allergies and asthma related issues.
Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you can't contribute does not mean that you cannot help:
<ul>

• Wether you have received a massage from me in the last two days or the last two years, if I have ever made a positive impact on you or a loved one and you are reading this, please share it with a friend, lover or family member and help me get the word out to absolutely everyone, because after all this is for everyone.
• Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Pin it, email the link or even just in passing tell someone about it.
• If every one of my existing clients pledges $20 and gets one friend to join them we will have sufficient income to start the project immediately.
So please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Message de Samy et Sachiyo
Un grand merci d'avance pour toutes les contributions. Grâce à vous, nous pourrons peut-être réaliser un petit rêve: Celui d'avoir notre propre chaise de massage japonaise! ^_^
Saviez-vous que la première chaise de massage au monde a été inventée dans la ville de Sachiyo, à Osaka? Heureuse coincidence? héhé

Enfin, bref, depuis très longtemps, nous sommes de grands adeptes des massages shiatsu japonais, et nous dépensons beaucoup d'argent chaque année pour nous faire masser. Sachiyo en particulier a régulièrement des maux de dos qui nuisent à sa qualité de vie...ce genre de traitement la soulage beaucoup.

C'est pourquoi si vous avez envie d'offrir toutes sortes de cadeaux pour notre mariage, nous vous encourageons plutôt à envoyer vos contributions en argent via ce site. Ceux-ci seront tous rassemblés et utilisés uniquement pour l'achat de la chaise.
Les contributions sont entièrement volontaires et laissées au jugement de chacun. Un montant de 125$ par invité est cependant suggéré pour atteindre notre objectif avec succès.

Le montant total de l'objectif a été arrondi et calculé en tenant compte du prix de la chaise, des taxes, des frais d'envoi, des frais d'installation et du pourcentage total perçu par ce site web pour offrir la réception de paiements par cartes de crédit et paypal.

Si vous préférez plutôt envoyer un bon vieux chèque bancaire, c'est aussi possible. Contactez-nous par courriel à l'adresse suivante pour obtenir l'adresse postale où envoyer votre contribution: mariage@samysachiyo.info
Il n'y a pas non plus de limite aux contributions, et le système est ouvert à tout le monde
column2: même ceux qui ne vont pas à la cérémonie et qui veulent offrir quelque chose peuvent le faire ici.

column1: La page sera ouverte jusqu'au 8 septembre pour recueillir les contributions tardives.
Encore une fois, un grand merci du fond du coeur, et à bientôt! (^_^)/
- Samy et Sachiyo
Pour en savoir plus
Si vous voulez en savoir un peu plus sur les chaises de massages japonaises, nous avons mis un petit reportage de 20min très intéressant là-dessus dans dans l'onglet ""galerie"" en haut.
Si vous ne le trouvez pas, voici le lien direct vers le vidéo:
https://vimeo.com/70257232

","Message de Samy et Sachiyo
Un grand merci d'avance pour toutes les contributions. Grâce à vous, nous pourrons peut-être réaliser un petit rêve: Celui d'avoir notre propre chaise de massage japonaise! ^_^
Saviez-vous que la première chaise de massage au monde a été inventée dans la ville de Sachiyo, à Osaka? Heureuse coincidence? héhé

Enfin, bref, depuis très longtemps, nous sommes de grands adeptes des massages shiatsu japonais, et nous dépensons beaucoup d'argent chaque année pour nous faire masser. Sachiyo en particulier a régulièrement des maux de dos qui nuisent à sa qualité de vie...ce genre de traitement la soulage beaucoup.

C'est pourquoi si vous avez envie d'offrir toutes sortes de cadeaux pour notre mariage, nous vous encourageons plutôt à envoyer vos contributions en argent via ce site. Ceux-ci seront tous rassemblés et utilisés uniquement pour l'achat de la chaise.
Les contributions sont entièrement volontaires et laissées au jugement de chacun. Un montant de 125$ par invité est cependant suggéré pour atteindre notre objectif avec succès.

Le montant total de l'objectif a été arrondi et calculé en tenant compte du prix de la chaise, des taxes, des frais d'envoi, des frais d'installation et du pourcentage total perçu par ce site web pour offrir la réception de paiements par cartes de crédit et paypal.

Si vous préférez plutôt envoyer un bon vieux chèque bancaire, c'est aussi possible. Contactez-nous par courriel à l'adresse suivante pour obtenir l'adresse postale où envoyer votre contribution: mariage@samysachiyo.info
Il n'y a pas non plus de limite aux contributions, et le système est ouvert à tout le monde
column2: même ceux qui ne vont pas à la cérémonie et qui veulent offrir quelque chose peuvent le faire ici.

column1: La page sera ouverte jusqu'au 8 septembre pour recueillir les contributions tardives.
Encore une fois, un grand merci du fond du coeur, et à bientôt! (^_^)/
- Samy et Sachiyo
Pour en savoir plus
Si vous voulez en savoir un peu plus sur les chaises de massages japonaises, nous avons mis un petit reportage de 20min très intéressant là-dessus dans dans l'onglet ""galerie"" en haut.
Si vous ne le trouvez pas, voici le lien direct vers le vidéo:
https://vimeo.com/70257232

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
About me
My name is Marita Hansen, and I am 33 years old and I live in Norway.

Most of my adult life I've suffered from depression and anxiety.  Because of this, I have not been able to work more than a few months once in a while. This again have caused some isolation on my part, and low self esteem.

Last January I was lucky to tag along with a few people who where going to go indoor climbing. I've always wanted to try it - and was really looking forward to it! I had promised myself that the first time I tried, no matter what, I would not give up before I reached the top.
And so I did! All five times! :-D

The rush was amazing! I was instantsly hooked. and was overwhelmed with all kinds of feelings, but mostly the one I've longed for for such a long time. A sense of accomplishment. I DID THAT! I climbed that wall.
So I did it again, and again, until my arms were so tired I had to stop. And I think I smiled for days :-)
I've experienced many times how fysical activity can help dealing with depression and anxiety. You get to know you body, and what it is capable of. What YOU are capable of.

And for me, climbing opened up something new in me. I had to trust the man holding the rope, I had to trust myself, I had to figure out the smartest way to go, how to use my body and my strength to get to the top.
And I want to do it again!

Because of my work situation, I don't have any money left to ""luxury""-things like theese. All my money go to rent, food and bills.

So I thought I should hear with you guys, if you wanted to help me. If you wanted to get me to climbs those walls, and gain strength, both mentally and fysically.
<div>
<h3>What I Need &amp
I want to start to climb at ""Klatreverket"" in Oslo.Norwegian site at www.klatreverket.no
My goal is to raise 750$.
This would go to:
<ul>
• Introduction course: 140$
• ""Certificate"" 10$
• Technique-course 1: 105$
• Technique-course 2: 105$
• Membership for ""25 climbs"": 397$
If I reach my goal past 750$, this I what I would use the money for:
<ul>
• Technique-course 3: 105$
• Introduction-course sport outdoors: 365$
• Own equipment. ?? $
What do YOU get out of this, me climbing up those walls?
You could get a hug. A personal thank-you note. Or I could knit you a hat! Or I will take you to climb yourself! :-)
<div>
The Impact

I am in a good place in my life, and in my recovery now. In the future I have  dreams about helping peple who struggles with depression, identity, anxiety and self-worth - and through activities like forexample climing, help them see and feel that they are strong and capable human beings.
But before I could make that difference in someone others life - I first have to get myself completely healthy and stable. And I am ready! :-)
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help
Not all of us are able to help financially - and if you are of them, I hope that you still want to share my story with your friends! Via Facebook, Twitter.. and so on.

Thank you so very much!

NEWS FLASH! Cornell has been accepted as a PRESENTER
at the Drum Circle Facilitator’s Guild Conference!
If you’ve been waiting,
column2: >now’s the time to make your contribution! Send him to these February drum conferences in healing, education and AT-RISK YOUTH!

column1: ***

Cornell ""Sugarfoot"" Coley is a reformed African and Latin dancer, now a successful healing drum therapist. Not that's he's given up dancing, but it now serves a greater purpose - to support the healing power of the drum.

After teaching dance for 25 years at UCLA, Tufts, Smith, Hampshire, Mt. Holyoke, Amherst and other colleges, Cornell still felt a gnawing emptiness that dance could not fill. And he was besieged by headaches for years.

It all came to a head at the Brazilian Dance Camp in 1999 when he was diagnosed with a brain tumor. After a whirlwind of emergency rooms, a shunt in his head and three-hour surgery, he was on the road to a second chance with no complications.

The following years were still confused with too many avenues, when an old colleague from the state arts council introduced him to Healing Arts:Pathways to Health. The director sent him as a talented novice into hospitals and veteran’s homes, covering three states. It was a great success.
Now, he’s found a unique career niche - bringing drumming into education &
column2: healing! And, his specialization in African and Latin traditions make his contributions unique to the movement.

column1: Meanwhile, his friend Richie Goldstein he succumbed to cancer in 2005 and left his unique creation, a toddler drum circle, without leadership. Cornell picked it up and built a successful weekly event, attracting families with toddlers of all abilities, races and classes.

Running this program for six years launched his reputation with early childhood and he accepted several requests last year to become a drum specialist in the Boston public school system. Only one thing remains - truly “expert” facilitation training in education, health and at-risk youth.
Cornell is raising funds to train with the best, including: Arthur Hull, Pioneer &
column2: Father of the Drum Circle Movement
column3: Christine Stephens, Author, Coach and Master Facilitator in Drum Therapy and Dr. Barry Bittman, neurologist, author, international speaker, researcher and innovator.

column1: These are the programs he will attend:
February 1 - 3 -- HealthRhythms Intensive  - Valencia, CA $1,200 total (registration, air fare, hotel)
February 15-17 -- DrumBeat Intensive - Panama City Beach, FL $1,300 total (registration, air fare, hotel)
February 22-24 -- Drum Circle Facilitator’s Guild - Watsonville, CA $1,000 total (registration, air fare, hotel)
A word from Cornell:
Thanks everybody! Here are perks I can offer you:
<ul>
• a signed copy of my band’s CD
• one-on-one mentoring by phone
• “A Fascinating Rhythm” my original, solo, interactive drum, dance and cultural performance that I’ve been doing for large audiences for 9 years in over 400 venues!
Please visit my web site www.afrolatin.net.
If you want to help and can’t contribute, please pass on this campaign to others through the social media that you use!
Thanks!

Help Us Lay Baby Logan to Rest.

My son and daughter-in law just experienced every parents nightmare. Fred and Ashley Hartley lost their son, Logan on July 20,2012 one month before he was to be welcomed to this world.  Ashley's placenta separated from her uterus and caused internal bleeding.  She was 36 weeks along and everything up until this point was a normal pregnancy. They did an emergency  C-section and baby Logan was stillborn.  Ashley received blood and might need more.  The entire family is devastated and heartbroken. Ashley is thinks she did something wrong and caused this to happen and both are having a rough time right now.

We are seeking financial assistance to lay Logan to rest, as this has been such an unexpected and heartwrencing event.  Fred and Ashley  have 3 other children and no medical insurance so this unexpected tragedy it has put a heavy burden on the family. We are requesting assistance with  funeral expenses to say goiodbye to our lost angel. This would help my son and daughter-in-law immensely. It will not make the pain go away but it will give a little closure on this horrible ordeal.

*****Neither one of the kids use drugs and Ashley did not drink alcohol the entire preganancy.  The pregnancy was completely normal until July 20 and the entire family was eagerly waiting Logan's arrival.*****
All funds will go to Logan's funeral. Thank you in advance for you kindness!

column3:
>Light energy is extremely good for you 

Thousands of clinical studies establish cells in our bodies thrive on light energy, resulting in a number of health and performance benefits including:

column1: • Rejuvenated skin
• Increased collagen
• Increased cellular energy
• Improved athletic performance
• Reduced fat

column4:
Sunlight:
we block healthy light energy at every turn

In modern life we live indoors, cover up with clothing and hide from UV.  So we fail to utilize nature's singular gift of light energy: sunlight. And the technology workaround's - laser and LED sessions - are expensive, inconvenient clinical solutions.
column9:
>Apparel that transforms sunlight into healthy light

A team of scientists have taken a fresh approach. The Lumiton SunShift is a classic casual shirt infused with laser technology that transforms sun energy into deep-penetrating, cool and HEALTHY red and near-infrared light. This new class of game-changing apparel is aptly called ""Light-Energized Apparel.""  

Though a simple shirt, its implications are vast.  The SunShift represents a disruptive and democratizing force in apparel.  Its technology transforms everyday clothing...the original wearable...into a multi-dimensional health and performance ""wearable"" accessible to everyone.
column12:
>How The SunShift Generates Healthy Light

The SunShift has been infused with highly efficient laser dyes that (1) absorb sunlight, (2) become energized, and (3) produce healthy red and near-infrared light that scatters into the body.
column13: >The SunShift fabric in action shifting light into healthy near-infrared light...
column18:
Cooling

The SunShift uses sunlight productively, absorbing it and immediately emitting it.  Two amazing byproducts of this technology action are cutting-edge innovations of their own right within two areas of modern apparel science - UV protection &
column19:
cooling.

  • UV PROTECTION. Despite its light weight, the SunShift is naturally UPF 50+ because one of the light wavelengths the laser technology recycles into healthy light is none other than Ultra-violet (or UV).

column1: COOLING.  The SunShift is cooler under the sun than other apparel. The laser technology does not allow sun energy to build up in the fabric, which creates a shade-like environment.
column2: >(left side of shirt) Thin rash guard  vs. SunShift (right side of shirt)
column5:
>To recap...when you purchase a SunShift
you will receive 3 distinct advantages
column7:
>Sunlight transformed into healthy red and near-infrared
light, the light wavelengths clinically proven to:

column1: • Increase collagen production
• Increase cellular energy (ATP)
• Increase blood circulation and new capillaries
• Reduce inflammation
• Reduce unhealthy fat

column3:
>The SunShift uniquely recycles both UVA and UVB into,
healthy light, which results in a super-thin, fabric that
also provides UPF 50+ UV protection.
column5:
>The SunShift does not hold onto the sun's energy so in  
sunlight it heats up less in than typical apparel. This removes
the heat effect of the sun, creating a cool shade-like experience.
column8:
Near-Infrared Light 

Hundreds of clinical and research studies establish the health benefits of red and near-infrared light for the body...and new studies keep coming. Body cells thrive when given red and near-infrared light. And not surprisingly, medical device companies, clinicians, and professional athletes have all jumped in. The question for the Lumiton team wasn't ""whether to give red and near-infrared light"" but ""how to give it better.""  Light-Energized Apparel was the scientific evolution that made the most sense.
column9:
>(Left) Metabolic activities impacted by red and near-infrared light
(Right) Healthy results of these metabolic activities (on right)

Why You Need This

Light-Energized Apparel is ground-breaking health and wellness technology that all of us should take advantage of everyday.  Why wouldn't you wear clothing that can make you healthier?

SunShift Product Details

We have taken great care to deliver a garment as high-end as it is technically advanced.

column1: • Made in the USA by the best manufacturers
• 100% polyester microfibers (some styles may include some spandex)
• Knit construction that is lightweight, breathable and moisture wicking
• Eco-friendly: solution-dyed yarns reduce water used in production
• Durable: laser dyes last lifetime of garment
<li>Light-Energized Apparel Benefits: Healthy Light (red or near-infrared, or both)

Styles

The SunShift is available in short sleeve crew neck - in a Women's style and in a Men's style.  We understand you need to look and feel good. The designs of the final working prototypes are below. We may make a few changes consistent with the style that we feel improve the garments.    

 

Colors

You will be able to choose among two original Lumiton colors - Lumia Red and Lumia Blue. Other colors may be made available (Note: these colors are shown on the Men's style shirt).

Size Guide

The SunShift T-shirt is available in the following sizes:
• Men:            S / M / L / XL / 2XL
• Women:     XS /  S  / M / L / XL

Campaign Details 

After you pre-order on Indiegogo, we'll send you a survey link via email to gather your product preferences (men / women, color, and size), shipping address and contact information. So please keep an eye out for an email from us. In the meantime, please send us an email with any questions (info@lumiton.com). 

The Team

Marco Scipioni (Co-Founder), Faramarz Farahi (Scientific Advisor), Gates Hinds (Co-Founder)

International Backers

All international shipments are subject to duties, taxes and clearing fees which you are responsible for paying. Most countries will assess duties/taxes on your package and in certain countries the carrier will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later. If you refuse delivery, your package will be abandoned. Once abandoned, we can’t ship another package to you or issue a refund.

column4: >-Our Flyer

column1: cannabis - an element of the right to health
<blockquote>
The “Medical Cannabis Declaration (MCD)” invites you to be a part of  our crowdfunding campaign for a world wide, multi-lingual information platform on medicinal cannabis!
<div>

column4: >What if you had a serious disease that prevented you from living a normal life? Conventional medicines may not always work. What if there was an affordable natural medicine that could help, but there was no reliable source of information about this medicine or national laws would not allow you to use it?

column1: This is the situation faced by millions of people around the world, who suffer from severe medical conditions, such as Multiple Sclerosis, epilepsy, chronic pain, severe depression and post traumatic stress disorder or chronic inflammatory diseases.
column4: > Combining the scientific knowledge of today with thousands of years of human experience, we are better equipped than ever to understand and share the knowledge behind nature's most versatile medicine.

column1: Only around 10 out of 200 countries in the world have legislation that grants their citizens access to the medical use of cannabis and cannabinoids, active compounds found in the cannabis plants, which can help improve patients’ quality of life considerably.

With your help, we will make scientific information on the uses medical cannabis freely available in the most spoken languages around the world, helping those in need to access reliable information that can improve their lives considerably. We want patients, medical professionals, policy makers and the general public to understand the scientific reality behind a plant that has been use for a varied group of diseases, for millennia.

Please support this world wide information campaign by donating or
sharing this information with your networks.
Empower patients who stand to benefit from medical cannabis.
Let us all say “Yes to cannabis as medicine”.
<div>
<b style=""background-color: initial
<div>
The Medical Cannabis Declaration (MCD) is
an online platform founded on 16 February 2013 in

Ruethen, Germany, established by world wide medical professionals and patients who believe that the access to cannabis should not be determined by geography. MCD aims at promoting safe and regular prescription and use of medical cannabis, globally. The charity wants to be part of a growing movement to change the negative perception on cannabis to assure its real medical values are recognised. We solely rely on scientific studies developed for the medical use of the cannabis plant. Visit us at: http://medical-cannabis-declaration.org/
Why donating?

When it comes to health issues, information is key. Under the motto ‘Say yes to cannabis as medicine’, the charity MCD aims to increase awareness of the benefits of medical cannabis by making decades of research freely available. Through its network of medical professionals, experts and patients, MCD will share scientific information in multiple languages targeted at medical professionals, policy makers and patients, alike.

With the budget raised through crowdfunding, among other activities, MCD will create and expand a database on all aspects of cannabis as medicine for patients and medical professionals as well as policy makers and the general public, freely made available in the most spoken languages in the world, distributed via newsletters, leaflets and other materials. The raised funds will also support close cooperation with existing platforms on cannabis as medicine and link and expand existing medical and patient networks – especially with the International Association for Cannabinoid Medicines (IACM: http://www.cannabis-med.org/

The project hopes to create a community of people who can help at the local, national and international levels by providing information on cannabis as medicine. The project will also support existing organisations, who fight for an improvement of medical cannabis access in their countries, and to help establish new ones, where those do not yet exist.
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
Dr Med Franjo Grotenhermen, Director of the MCD charity
Honours medical graduate from the University of Cologne, Germany. Franjo is a
renowned expert on the medical use of cannabis and Executive Director of the
International Association for Cannabinoid Medicines (IACM), with several books and scientific articles published on the topic.

MA Luis Sarmento, Project coordinator

Author of several papers on cannabis and cannabinoids, Luis has years of experience on the field. Passionate activist, Luis has participated in several campaigns, organisations and associations related to cannabis. He joined MCD in 2015, where he is project and communications coordinator.
","Click below for:-All Videos                                                           -Latest Press Releases -Lectures on Cannabis as Medicine                -Our FlyerAccess to medical
cannabis - an element of the right to health
The “Medical Cannabis Declaration (MCD)” invites you to be a part of  our crowdfunding campaign for a world wide, multi-lingual information platform on medicinal cannabis!

What if you had a serious disease that prevented you from living a normal life? Conventional medicines may not always work. What if there was an affordable natural medicine that could help, but there was no reliable source of information about this medicine or national laws would not allow you to use it?

This is the situation faced by millions of people around the world, who suffer from severe medical conditions, such as Multiple Sclerosis, epilepsy, chronic pain, severe depression and post traumatic stress disorder or chronic inflammatory diseases. Combining the scientific knowledge of today with thousands of years of human experience, we are better equipped than ever to understand and share the knowledge behind nature's most versatile medicine.

Only around 10 out of 200 countries in the world have legislation that grants their citizens access to the medical use of cannabis and cannabinoids, active compounds found in the cannabis plants, which can help improve patients’ quality of life considerably.

With your help, we will make scientific information on the uses medical cannabis freely available in the most spoken languages around the world, helping those in need to access reliable information that can improve their lives considerably. We want patients, medical professionals, policy makers and the general public to understand the scientific reality behind a plant that has been use for a varied group of diseases, for millennia.
Please support this world wide information campaign by donating orsharing this information with your networks.
Empower patients who stand to benefit from medical cannabis.
Let us all say “Yes to cannabis as medicine”.

Short Summary

Homeopathy is regularly attacked in the media, and those of us who appreciate the science and art of homeopathy want and need a strong advocate who can respond to the misinformation that skeptics of homeopathy are providing.  Most recently, the U.S. government's Federal Trade Commission (FTC) has issued a ruling asserting that the marketing of homeopathic medicines must now include a statement that there is no scientific evidence that homeopathic medicines work and that homeopathic principles derive from the 1700s that are not accepted by most medical experts.

Dana Ullman, MPH, CCH, is presently in the process of finishing writing a detailed response to this FTC ruling.  By the time you come to this website, he may have already published this article at one or more websites.  Besides this article, future responses will also be important, even vitally important.

As you may know, Dana Ullman has authored 10 books on homeopathy, two of which contain a Foreword by the Physician to Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II.  Dana has also written chapters on homeopathy in four leading medical textbooks, including two that were published by Oxford University Press and one by the American Pain Management Association.  He has lectured at Stanford Medical School, UCSF School of Medicine, UC Davis School of Medicine, Duke Medical School, UC Berkeley, NYU School of Journalism, amongst many  others.

Dana is intimately familiar with the scientific evidence that presently exists for homeopathy, and he has consistently written compelling articles that convince people of the value of homeopathy and homeopathic medicines.

Dana has written many articles at the Huffingtonpost that have reached hundreds of thousands of people, but he cannot afford the time and effort that it takes to write such articles or to work to promote them so that large numbers of people read these articles.  The very survival of homeopathy today depends upon people like Dana who are defending homeopathy in the media.
To see many of Dana's writings at the Huffingtonpost, click HERE.

Dana does not want to ask any homeopathic pharmacy for contributions because the skeptics will then simply assert that he is shilling for homeopathic drug companies.  Instead, he wants to and needs the support from individuals who appreciate homeopathy and who appreciate the special strong defense that Dana provides to and for this science and art of healing.
Previously, Dana simply volunteered his time and expertise to writing articles, but he cannot afford to that anymore.  He needs your support.
The more support Dana gets, the more articles and media he will create.
Give till it helps.
Give till it heals.
Put your wallet where you heart is...and where your health is...
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot afford anything yourself, please simply inform others about this important advocacy for homeopathy.
Please also use Social Media to tell others about Dana Ullman's articles on homeopathy.
Also, if and when you need any homeopathic books, medicines, medicine kits, or anything homeopathic, go to:  www.homeopathic.com

And if you want to learn how to use a homeopathic medicine kit, go to our special new website that provides an e-course in ""Learning to Use a Homeopathic Medicine Kit"":  www.HomeopathicFamilyMedicine.com

Finally, if you or someone near and dear to you wants or need professional homeopathic treatment, Dana Ullman ""sees"" many of his patients these days via SKYPE and the telephone.  Write to:  email@homeopathic.com to arrange for an appointment.

Overview

When we were young girls, our mothers taught us the importance of being able to succeed on our own. We truly believe that our awareness for financial boundaries, motivation to support ourselves by having a job, and curiosity for learning helped fuel our passionate and entrepreneuristic hearts. Kalumi wants your help in giving to girls Inc., an organization that encourages girls to grow to their best potential by being healthy, strong, and smart!

 

Who is girls Inc.?

THE GIRLS INC. DIFFERENCE

Today, girls continue to encounter significant obstacles to their well-being and success.

girls Inc. meets these challenges by helping girls explore and celebrate their strengths, their voices, who they are today, and who they will become, through a sustained presence throughout the school day and after school. girls Inc. serves girls ages 6 to 18 with hands- on, minds-on experiences that meet their needs and challenges at each stage of growing up. 

download girls inc. one pager

Your pre-purchase of Cheeky Chai will help empower young girls!

 

Our Goal &
column2:
What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10K during the exclusive launch of Cheeky Chai through Indiegogo. All profits from this campaign will be donated to girls Inc. once the campaign closes.

Cheeky Chai is the 4th addition to KALUMI BEAUTYfood- a marine collagen bar line. We are not only offering a variety of special perks on Cheeky Chai through this campaign, but we are also offering a panel discussion here in LA to 30 lovely funders. One lucky set of backers will even get the opportunity to join Kalumi on a trip to Hawaii for our campaign shoot and learn the ins and outs of what it takes to be a model!

 

Our Track Record

Kalumi launched in January of 2017 and quickly gained momentum in high-end retail spaces such as Free People, GOOP, Riley Rose and soon to come, Urban Outfitters. Kalumi was crowned “best in show” by Indie Beauty Expo for “Best Ingestible Beauty” and has been featured in fashion magazines such as Nylon, Town &
column3:
Country. Even Vogue's own, Helena Suric calls Kalumi her ""skincare secret.""

 

INTRODUCING CHEEKY CHAI

Not so nuts about nuts? We have something special for you! Introducing Cheeky Chai- our first sunflower seed based BEAUTYfood bar! This exotic addition to the Kalumi family is unique, comforting, and full of flavor mocking your favorite vanilla chai latte! In addition Cheeky Chai ensures that those who avoid nuts, due to preference or sensitivities, also have access to a healthy, clean, and beautifying snack! 

 

If you don't already know, Kalumi BEAUTYfood bars all contain a full 12G serving of marine collagen- known to not only aid the gut but also known for it's youth-promoting benefits for hair, skin &
column4:
nail health.*

Kalumi's 3 favorite beauty-boosting ingredients:

CLICK HERE FOR MORE ON MARINE COLLAGEN

*These statements have not been evaluated by the FDA. This product is not intended to diagnose, treat, cure, or prevent any disease.

Ingredients: Sunflower Seed Butter, Hydrolyzed Marine Collagen Peptides, Organic Yacon Syrup, Sweet Potato, Cocoa Butter, Tapioca, Vanilla, Cinnamon, Ginger, Himalayan Pink Salt, Turmeric, Clove, Black Pepper, Cardamom.

Nut free, gluten free, dairy free, soy free, non-GMO and model approved. *DISCLAIMER our products are manufactured in a facility that also processes nuts.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends, family and co-workers about Kalumi! Help us spread the word so we can not only help girls inc. but be in every busy girls handbag, desktop table, briefcase, or gym bag!

VISIT KALUMIHEALTH.COM

Short Summary
Hi, I'm Jess from England and I've been volunteering and working in South Africa for 9 years with an epic NPO called Genesis and a Church called Norwegian Settlers Church.
I came out to South Africa when I was 18 to uplift teenagers and children in communities who are affected by HIV/AIDS. I love the country, the people who live here and the organisation I work with.
I am currently working at a community centre which runs educational support programmes, youth groups, cell group and leadership activities for young people aged 5-25.

At Youthworx, we LOVE to play sports! In fact, our video is inspired by the literal use of bins and other household items to play sports around our centre! We have a dream to put up a sports centre that will allow young people to play sports in a safe Christian founded environment.

We have already been nominated by a bank for the 'Local Hero's Award' this year and they have given us $1000 towards the start of our sports centre. We are hoping that other people will see and understand the importance of our dream which is to provide a quality safe place for youth in a community-away from the many negative influences such as drugs, alcohol, sex and the risk of HIV infection.
It would mean the world to us if you supported our dream!
What We Need &
We have already received $1000 in donations for our side netting but need another $1000 for our brick wall.
We are starting by fundraising for the brick wall which we can hopefully put up asap!!! We will still need funding after that for our surface material but this is our starting point.

At Youthworx, we want to recognise and remember every person who helps us to achieve our dream. For every person who sponsors us, we want to paint their names and towns on the brick wall of our sports centre. That way people can see how many friends we have around the world!!! 

The Impact

We have 50 children coming to our educational support programmes, 100 high schoolers coming to our senior youth group, 50 who come to our junior youth group, 30 young adults in our cell group and 5 schools who we network with including a primary school called Cornerstone which hosts children with autism.
All of these young people and children will directly benefit from our sports centre!

We particularly hope to host children during the day who are home schooled so that they can have access to sports facilities which other students have going to main stream schools.

Risks &
The cost of our dream sports centre is quite a bit-we have been quoted £15,000. We are hoping to build it bit by with with what we can afford and fundraise.

However, we have also had individual sponsors and businesses voice their desire to support our dream in substantial ways. We are also a NPO which means we can give Tax Certificates for donations for businesses who want to sponsor us through that avenue. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our dream with your friends, church or business. Perhaps you would consider becoming a fundraiser on our behalf and run a race for us or do some other activity for our worthy cause. You can share this page through Indigogo's sharing tools so check them out!

column2:

Our Vision of working with local community leaders to create a better life for our kids

column1: I'm Chris Scurr, a member of the Los Barriles Rotary Club and I need your help.

Rotary International led the campaign that has almost eradicated Polio for our Planet. We are very effective when we work as a team with our community and our Rotary Volunteer Members and once again will  host the world class ""Lord of the Wind"" International ( IKA) Kiteboarding Competition in Los Barriles, Baja California Sur, Mexico from Jan 13 - 17, 2016. 100% of the proceeds of the event go to improving  lives in our community.

We provide a local Supervised Technology Center for the kids to do homework and research. We have made needed upgrades to area schools as well as providing special water treatment systems to give clean drinking water to the outlying ranches and small country communities.
Mexican kids have many challenges and we know that keeping kids active in group sports activities can build character, keep them healthy and out of a life of drugs and trouble.

Playing active sports can avoid or change that outcome. I am passionate about my chosen community and its future. Kids are our future.  My Rotary International colleagues and I want to work on upgrading the three facilities in our town to allow more kids to play active sports and be happy and lead healthy lives.

Our club just recently celebrated 10 years of service in our town and  as hosts for the ""Lord of the Wind"" kiteboarding competition on  Jan 13 - 17, 2016.  The proceeds from this ""Kick it for Kids"" campaign  100% directed to upgrading the sports and activity facilities for the children of the area.
<div>
So I ask you to also ""Kick it for the Kids"" and help us in this rewarding effort!
<div style=""text-align: center
column2: >You can make the difference!
column3:
>

Our current facilities are unsafe, inadequate, poorly lit and don't encourage positive activities

We will provide perimeter fencing at the facilities, so stray balls are safely contained and allowing these same facilities to service additional sports such as Pickleball, that adults can also enjoy.

column1: We will rebuild the old washrooms into useable, sanitary places for the kids and parents.
We will upgrade all the equipment that they badly need.
We will provide team uniforms.
With our local partners in Sport, we will train and empower coaches and volunteer parent helpers.
We will provide solar powered flood lighting for evening play and sport.
We want to reach out to the Mexican community members and the ex-patriot community alike, so that everyone can benefit from the improved facilities.
100% of funds raised will go to this needed project for the kids.
Our Rotary Club will honour your contributions with attractive gifts, recognizing your commitment to our kids.

The Impact

  • Supporting these improvements will positively affect the lives of our local kids.
  • Our town Technology center is an example of a similar campaigne ran 3 years ago. It has proven to be a huge hit and has vastly improved kids education and has produced a national award winning student in developing the latest in electric propulsion system for marine use. Designed right here!
• This is about helping to build GOOD communities and personal outcomes.
• Please be part of it.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

Our only fear is that not enough people will see this appeal and catch the Vision and our Passion.

  • it will require everyone to share this message and appeal.
  • Please share this page with all your friends and contacts through Indiegogo Share Tools.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please folks get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Playing active sports can avoid or change that outcome. I am passionate about my chosen community and its future. Kids are our future.  My Rotary International colleagues and I want to work on upgrading the three facilities in our town to allow more kids to play active sports and be happy and lead healthy lives.

Our club just recently celebrated 10 years of service in our town and  as hosts for the ""Lord of the Wind"" kiteboarding competition on  Jan 13 - 17, 2016.  The proceeds from this ""Kick it for Kids"" campaign  100% directed to upgrading the sports and activity facilities for the children of the area.
So I ask you to also ""Kick it for the Kids"" and help us in this rewarding effort!

You can make the difference!   Our current facilities are unsafe, inadequate, poorly lit and don't encourage positive activities We will provide perimeter fencing at the facilities, so stray balls are safely contained and allowing these same facilities to service additional sports such as Pickleball, that adults can also enjoy.
We will rebuild the old washrooms into useable, sanitary places for the kids and parents.
We will upgrade all the equipment that they badly need.
We will provide team uniforms.
With our local partners in Sport, we will train and empower coaches and volunteer parent helpers.
We will provide solar powered flood lighting for evening play and sport.
We want to reach out to the Mexican community members and the ex-patriot community alike, so that everyone can benefit from the improved facilities.
100% of funds raised will go to this needed project for the kids.
Our Rotary Club will honour your contributions with attractive gifts, recognizing your commitment to our kids.

The Impact  Supporting these improvements will positively affect the lives of our local kids. Our town Technology center is an example of a similar campaigne ran 3 years ago. It has proven to be a huge hit and has vastly improved kids education and has produced a national award winning student in developing the latest in electric propulsion system for marine use. Designed right here!
This is about helping to build GOOD communities and personal outcomes.
Please be part of it.

Risks & Challenges Our only fear is that not enough people will see this appeal and catch the Vision and our Passion.  it will require everyone to share this message and appeal. Please share this page with all your friends and contacts through Indiegogo Share Tools.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Please folks get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools!",5.0,0,"4 Campaigns
|","Los Barriles Baja California Sur, Mexico",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kick-it-for-kids/pica
